ExplntnTxt: FUNDS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS FOR TUITION ASSISTANCE TO ATTEND THE 2015- 2016 ACADEMIC SCHOOL YEAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE MASSACHUSETTS CONFERENCE FOR WOMEN AND THE GREATER BOSTON CHAMBER OF COMMERCE. THESE ENTITIES PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR BUSINESS NETWORKING, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, EDUCATION, AND PERSONAL GROWTH FOR WOMEN. PART III THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. MANY SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC STRENGTH, ATHLETIC ABILITY, AND LEADERSHIP OR COMMUNITY SERVICE. NON-NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING IS AWARDED THROUGH THE ADMISSIONS PROCESS AND USUALLY HAS A GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR OTHER REQUIREMENT FOR RENEWAL IN SUBSEQUENT YEARS. TYPES OF MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDE THE TRUSTEE SCHOLARSHIP, THE PRESIDENT'S SCHOLARSHIP AND THE INTERNATIONAL SCHOLARSHIP. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO OFFERS GRANT FUNDS THAT ARE AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND DO NOT HAVE TO BE REPAID. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE DETERMINES THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF A STUDENT'S NEED-BASED GRANT FUNDING ACCORDING TO FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL FORMULAS. TYPES OF NEED BASED GRANTS INCLUDE BENTLEY SCHOLARSHIPS, AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE SOURCES. ALL SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CREDITED TO THE INDIVIDUAL'S STUDENT ACCOUNT.

SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE IS GIVEN TO INDIGENT CANCER PATIENTS TO ASSIST THEM WITH ANCILLARY COSTS DURING TREATMENT. ASSISTANCE IS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE CENTER'S CHARITY CARE POLICY AND IS COORDINATED THROUGH THE SOCIAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT. SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE INCLUDES TRANSPORTATION REIMBURSEMENT TO THE TREATMENT FACILITY, LODGING, FOOD, EXERCISE PROGRAMS, MEDICAL SUPPLIES AND SUPPORT GROUP COSTS.

DETAIL OF SUBAWARDS IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS RESEARCH ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER MAKES SUB-AWARDS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT PERFORM RESEARCH IN CONNECTION WITH RESEARCH GRANTS AWARDED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT CATEGORIZE THESE SUB-AWARDS AS "GRANTS" FOR FORM 990, SCHEDULE I REPORTING, SINCE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PERFORM RESEARCH SERVICES FOR THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE CONSIDERED INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS WHICH SERVE THE DIRECT NEEDS OF THE UNIVERSITY. --------------------

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 AND PART III
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE DISBURSEMENT OF GRANTS AND FEDERAL LOANS TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER ARE SELECTED AND THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR LOANS DETERMINED BY OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY PROCESSES APPLIED TO ALL SIMILARLY SITUATED INDIVIDUALS. THE DECISIONS ARE MADE ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS THROUGH EVALUATING THE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED OF THE APPLICANT IN LIGHT OF THE FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR THIS PURPOSE. --------------------

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS
ExplntnTxt: LAKESIDE AND MIDLANDS PROVIDED 17 SCHOLARSHIPS DURING FISCAL YEAR 2019 TO STUDENTS INTERESTED IN THE HEALTHCARE INDUSTRY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MOST DISBURSEMENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE MADE DIRECTLY IN THE ACTIVE CONDUCT OF THE ACTIVITIES CONSTITUTING THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OR FUNCTION OF THE ORGANIZATION. OTHERWISE, DISTRIBUTIONS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE INSTITUTION'S EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROCEDURES OR SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE INSTITUTION'S GOVERNING BOARD OR MANAGEMENT DESIGNED TO ENSURE THAT RECIPIENTS OF SUCH DISBURSEMENTS FROM THE ORGANIZATION ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED AND GRANTED TO QUALIFIED RECIPIENTS. ALEGENT CREIGHTON HEALTH ONLY DISTRIBUTES FUNDS TO OTHER 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS WITH THE SAME MISSION and PURPOSE AS THE ALEGENT CREIGHTON HEALTH SYSTEM. THESE DISTRIBUTIONS ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY ARE BEING USED AS SPECIFIED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

Need based financial aid comprises the larger part of the grants described in Part III. The staff in the Financial Aid Office make the determination of amounts of grants awarded to individual students based on documentation provided. Need based grants are awarded for a maximum of eight semesters, subject to satisfactory academic progress. Merit based aid is awarded for a maximum of eight semesters and requires maintaining a minimum GPA of 3.0.

ONCE THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP HAVE BEEN REVIEWED AND MET, GFU DISBURSES FINANCIAL AID FUNDS TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNT DIRECTLY, ENSURING THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED FOR TUITION AND EDUCATIONAL COSTS.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN ITS PROGRAMS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON STUDENT ACHIEVEMENTS IN ACADEMICS, PERFORMING ARTS, AND ATHLETICS. TO BE CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE, STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR ADMISSION, SUBMIT ACADEMIC TRANSCIPTS OF PRIOR EDUCATIONAL WORK, SUBMIT TEST SCORES (ACT/SAT), AND SUBMIT AN APPLICATION FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. SOME SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRE ADDITIONAL RECOMMENDATIONS OR CERTIFICATIONS BY THIRD PARTIES. ACADEMIC PROGRESS OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS IS MONITERED, AND THEY MUST EARN A MINIMUM AMOUNT OF COLLEGE CREDITS AND A MINIMUM GPA EACH SEMESTER IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY.

Scholarships are available to all students meeting the written criteria for the award of the scholarship. All scholarships and discounts are awarded by the financial aid department based on the established policies. Scholarships are directly applied to the student account.
Grants will only be made to 501(c)(3) and 501(c)(6) organizations to ensure the funds will be used properly.

All grant funds received by the university are overseen by our Financial Aid Department. The Director of Financial Aid works closely with the Dept of Education and our Student Accounts Department to ensure proper management of the students' funds. As funds are approved and released, disbursement reports are given to our Student Accounts Department and funds are electronically uploaded to the individual student tuition accounts and verified for accuracy. All funds are uploaded within the prescribed window of three business days and all funds are available to the student with 14 days of disbursement to their account.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE DETERMINED TO BE WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR EACH COLLEGE CONTINUOUSLY MONITOR STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS.
All assistance to individuals is in the form of financial aid, grants, scholarships and tuition discounts awarded to students. Assistance is applied directly to the student's account balance.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Per Bon Secours Mercy Health's system-wide financial and accounting policies, contributions are generally made as reimbursements for funds spent. In such cases, the donee/grantee organization must provide documentation to the filing organization before funds are approved for disbursement.

RECORDS OF GRANTS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AND ARE PERIODICALLY RECONCILED WITH BUSINESS OFFICE RECORDS, INCLUDING THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND INSTITUTIONAL BUDGET.
Scholarships are determined by FAFSA requirements, and need base.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT OR FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS APPLY FOR INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON THE CRITERIAL FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIP THEY ARE AWARDED BY A COMMITTEE. ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DURING THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS AND ARE AWARDED BASED UPON MERIT. FRESHMAN ENROLLMENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED TO INCOMING FRESHMEN BASED UPON THEIR INDIVIDUAL HIGH SCHOOL PERFORMANCE, SAT SCORES, AND FINANCIAL NEEDS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENT MATRICULATION AT THE COLLEGE, THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.

The Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships at Anderson University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the University does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University to ensure students remain eligible for funds awarded.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part II, Line 1(h) Explanation of purpose of grant or assistance
ExplntnTxt: Payments related to work performed on research subcontract related to federal, state or private grant originally made to the University and other assistance in accordance with the University's exempt mission.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS MADE FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ARE INITIATED BY A FORMAL SUB-CONTRACT EXECUTED BY BOTH PARTIES. THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EACH GRANT CONTAIN ALL THE GUIDELINES FOR INVOICING, BILLING, RECORD RETENTION, AUDITS, ETC. RESEARCH AND SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING ("RSPA") AND THE NOTRE DAME RESEARCH OFFICE WORK IN TANDEM TO ENSURE THE GUIDELINES ARE ADHERED TO. ALMOST ALL SUBCONTRACTS FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ARE PAID ON A COST REIMBURSEMENT BASIS. ALL INVOICES PAID FOR COSTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR BASED ON COMPLETION OF WORK, DELIVERABLES MET, ETC. IN ADDITION, RSPA MONITORS THE PAYMENTS AGAINST THE TOTAL BUDGET TO ENSURE PAYMENT IS NOT MADE ABOVE THE STIPULATED CEILING. THE UNIVERSITY HAS A POLICY CONTAINING GUIDELINES SURROUNDING SUB-CONTRACTS, SOME OF WHICH WERE ADDRESSED ABOVE. THIS POLICY CAN BE FOUND AT: HTTP://CONTROLLER.ND.EDU/ASSETS/91679/SUBRECIPIENT_MONITORING.PDF. CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS THAT RECEIVE CONTRIBUTIONS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE CAREFULLY SELECTED AND REQUIRE DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY'S INTEREST IN THE ORGANIZATION TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY WITH THE CORE VALUES OF THE UNIVERSITY. CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS ALSO REQUIRE THE APPROVAL OF THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT, EXCEPT FOR THOSE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS MADE THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S DONOR ADVISED FUND PROGRAM, WHICH UNDERGO A THOROUGH VETTING PROCESS BY THE UNIVERSITY'S TAX DEPARTMENT TO ENSURE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION MEETS THE IRS'S DEFINITION OF A 501(C)(3) NOT FOR PROFIT CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FUNDING TO STUDENTS AND OTHER RELATED INDIVIDUALS FOR RESEARCH AND OTHER ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT THE FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION. FUNDS PROVIDED ARE MONITORED THROUGH APPLICATIONS, BUDGETS AND A REQUIREMENT TO DOCUMENT THE USE OF FUNDS EITHER PRIOR TO THE DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDS OR UPON COMPLETION OF THE ACTIVITY.

The College follows federal, state and institutional policies and regulations to monitor grants and funds: 1) the student applies for the grants; 2) grants are awarded from the various funding sources depending on need and/or academic standing; 3) the student's eligibility is verified through federal, state and institutional requirements, matriculation, registration, attendance and academic progress; 4) grants and awards are processed onto the student's account; 5) where loans are involved, the College follows up with the regulatory requirements after graduation. The Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is an integral part of this process.
Institutional scholarships and grants are monitored by disbursing funds from financial aid to the business office.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Org. Proc. for Monitoring grants
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS IN SUPPORT OF NORTHWEST COMMUNITY HOSPITAL'S (HOSPITAL) MISSION ARE MONITORED BY NORTHWEST COMMUNITY'S FINANCE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS PART OF THE MONTHLY REVIEW OF HOSPITAL'S FINANCIAL RESULTS. SIGNIFICANT GRANTS TO UNRELATED 501(C)(3) OR GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS ARE APPROVED BY HOSPITAL'S COMMUNITY SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND ARE MONITORED THROUGH ONGOING INTERACTIONS WITH OFFICIALS OF THOSE RECIPIENTS REGARDING PROGRAM SERVICES PROVIDED IN HOSPITAL'S SERVICE AREA.

Schedule I Part I Line 2: Donations made by Covenant Medical Center, Inc. to charitable organizations are made in furtherance of the recipient organization's exempt purpose. Donations are included in community benefits in Schedule H if the contribution has been formally restricted to a community benefit activity that meets the criteria to be reported on Schedule H.

MIDLAND UNIVERSITY OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

ST. EDWARD'S UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS USING A TASK FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT, COMPLIANCE AND FUNDS MANAGEMENT, AND ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDITS. THE ENROLLMENT COMMITTEE REVIEWS AWARDING AND RENEWAL POLICIES FOR THE UNIVERSITY GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AND ESTABLISHES FRESHMEN AND TRANSFER ENROLLMENT GOALS ALONG WITH THE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING STRATEGY NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS. THE COMMITTEE ENGAGES A NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED LEADER IN THE ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING FIELD TO ASSIST IN THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MONITORING OF FRESHMEN AND TRANSFER ENROLLMENT GOALS AND FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING. EACH COMMITTEE MEMBER AND OTHER KEY UNIVERSITY PERSONNEL RECEIVE WEEKLY REPORTS THROUGHOUT THE FINANCIAL AID AWARDING CYCLE. THE TASK FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT IS COMPRISED OF THE PROVOST, VICE PRESIDENT STUDENT AFFAIRS, VICE PRESIDENT FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, VICE PRESIDENT ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT, VICE PRESIDENT MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS, VICE PRESIDENT INSTITUTIONAL EFFECTIVENESS AND PLANNING, ASSOCIATE VICE PRESIDENTS ACADEMIC SERVICES, ASSOCIATE VICE PRESIDENTS ACADEMIC AFFAIRS, ASSOCIATE VICE PRESIDENT ATHLETICS AND THE DIRECTOR OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE AND PROPER FUND MANAGEMENT, THE UNIVERSITY USES AN ENTERPRISE SOFTWARE TO TRACK ALL FUNDING SOURCES FOR SCHOLARSHIPS FROM UNIVERSITY, FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND PRIVATE SOURCES. THE SOFTWARE HAS A COMPREHENSIVE COMPLIANCE AND FUNDS MANAGEMENT MODULE AND ALLOWS STAFF TO ADD ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONALITY AS NECESSARY. THE COMPLIANCE MODULE IDENTIFIES GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP OFFERS THAT FAIL TO MEET AWARDING CRITERIA AND PREVENTS FINANCIAL AID FROM BEING APPLIED TO A STUDENT IF THE STUDENT DOES NOT MEET THE DISBURSING CRITERIA. FINANCIAL AID RECORDS AND UNIVERSITY GENERAL LEDGER RECORDS ARE RECONCILED USING THE FUNDS MANAGEMENT FUNCTION. ADDITIONAL MONITORING IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH DIAGNOSTIC REPORTS BY FINANCIAL AID IDENTIFYING CODES, TYPES OF GRANTS, FORMS OF GRANTS AND INDIVIDUAL FUNDING SOURCES. ANNUAL AUDITS ARE PERFORMED BY AN INDEPENDENT PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM THAT RENDERS AN OPINION AS TO WHETHER FEDERAL AND CERTAIN STATE FUNDED FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS ARE EXERCISED IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS AND REGULATIONS GOVERNING SAID PROGRAMS.

EACH TRANSACTION INVOLVING GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, OR FINANCIAL AID IS MONITORED THROUGH THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES ANNUAL AUDITS OF ITS FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES. THE AUDITORS TEST THE UNIVERSITY'S COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE RULES AND REGULATIONS.
STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. TRAVEL AND STUDENT RESEARCH GRANTS REQUIRE SUBSTANTIATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III: ACCOUNTING FOR CASH AND NONCASH ASSISTANCE:
ExplntnTxt: PAYMENTS/REIMBURSEMENTS DIRECTLY TO RECIPIENTS ARE CONSIDERED CASH ASSISTANCE. PAYMENTS TO VENDORS TO BENEFIT RECIPIENTS, OR THE PURCHASE OF NONCASH ITEMS TO BE GIVEN TO RECIPIENTS, ARE CONSIDERED NONCASH ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, COLUMN B: NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS IS BASED ON FINANCIAL AID RECORDS OF RECIPIENTS. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR PRIZES AND AWARDS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH PRIZES/AWARDS), AND THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS BENEFITTED OR NUMBER OF ITEMS PURCHASED (NONCASH PRIZES/AWARDS). THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT RESEARCH AND TRAVEL GRANTS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH GRANTS), AND/OR THE NUMBER OF RESEARCH PROJECTS FUNDED (CASH AND NONCASH GRANTS).

SUMMIT'S TUITION COST IS $5,940 PER STUDENT. SOME STUDENTS MAY NOT QUALIFY FOR ANY AID FROM TITLE IV OR STATE PROGRAMS. STUDENTS REQUESTING ASSISTANCE COMPLETE A FORMAL REQUEST AND SUBMIT IT TO THE SUPPORT SERVICE OFFICE. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY THE SUPPORT SERVICES MANAGER, CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE THEN MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND ACADEMIA ARE MONITORED BY THE REGISTRAR.
THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTHWESTERN OHIO AWARDS FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID POLICIES.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: THE UNIVERSITY'S GRANTS IN THE U.S. CONSIST OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS WHICH ARE APPLIED AGAINST STUDENTS' RECEIVABLE BALANCES DUE TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THESE GRANTS BY CONTROLLING THE APPLICATION OF GRANTS TO STUDENTS' BALANCES.

STUDENTS FILL OUT A FAFSA TO SEE WHAT GOVERNMENT AID THEY QUALIFY FOR. THE DIRECTOR FOR FINANCIAL AID AWARDS THE GOVERNMENT AID BASED ON TITLE IV RULES AND REGULATIONS AND AID FROM THE COLLEGE BASED ON COLLEGE POLICY. RECORDS ON FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN STUDENT FILES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS AUDITED ANNUALLY.

THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS GUIDELINES SET BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, AND STATE GOVERNMENTS, TO ENSURE THAT GRANTS TO STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS. ALL DOCUMENTATION REGARDING THE AWARDING OF THESE GRANTS IS MAINTAINED IN THE STUDENT FILE.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE THAT SELECTS ALL SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON BOTH MERIT AND NEED.

STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID THROUGH CAREFUL STUDY OF THE INFORMATION ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA), THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD, TEST SCORES, AND RECOMMENDATIONS. DETAILED RECORDS AND STATISTICS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND THE OFFICE OF ASSESSMENT AND INSTITUTIONAL RESEARCH IN REGARDS TO ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE, INCLUDING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE METHOD USED TO MONITOR FUNDS INCORPORATE THE FOLLOWING CORE CONCEPTS: A) EXPECTATIONS ARE DOCUMENTED, B) A BUDGET IS ESTABLISHED, C) WRITTEN REPORTS ARE REQUIRED, D) THE COLLEGE BUDGET OFFICER REVIEWS REPORTS AND MONITORS THE RELATED BUDGET, E) THE COLLEGE BUDGET OFFICER CONTACTS OVERSEAS ORGANIZATIONS TO VERIFY THAT THE RECIPIENT IS ENGAGED AS PLANNED. METHOD 2: IN CASE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID, ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MONITORED.

URSINUS COLLEGE PROVIDED GRANTS TOTALING $83,864 TO 91 URSINUS COLLEGE STUDENTS IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING FOR CAMPUS HOUSING, PRIMARILY FOR SUMMER RESEARCH. THE GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AT URSINUS COLLEGE. URSINUS COLLEGE PROVIDED GRANTS TOTALING $45,680,938 TO 1,593 URSINUS COLLEGE STUDENTS IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING FOR TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD FOR THE ACADEMIC YEAR 2018-19. THE GRANTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AT URSINUS COLLEGE. URSINUS COLLEGE PROVIDED GRANTS TOTALING $183,500 TO 99 URSINUS COLLEGE STUDENTS IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING FOR STIPENDS WHILE ENGAGED IN SUMMER RESEARCH PROJECTS ON CAMPUS. THE STIPENDS ARE DISBURSED VIA PAYROLL TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS.

GRANTS ARE FOR TUITION AND FEES THAT ARE DISBURSED IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURES THAT THE STUDENTS ARE WITHIN THEIR BUDGET ALLOWANCE. ADDITIONAL GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO PAY FOR BOOKS.

FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENT, ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF EXPENDED FUNDS IS PERFORMED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT AND COLLEGE GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THE DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The college receives grant funds from the U.S. Department of Education through the Title III and IV programs. The college awards federal financial aid to students based on eligibility criteria specified by federal regulations. The college has sophisticated internal processes to determine a student's eligibility for federal financial aid, and to monitor compliance.
Student financial aid is credited to the individual student accounts and their net balances are monitored by the Business Office.
Grant funds consist mainly of institutional discounts for employees of Los Angeles Pacific University. The scholarships are applied directly to students' accounts.

BETHAN LUTHERAN COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT OF POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS. THESE AWARDS ARE MONITORED AND AWARDED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID.

THE AWARDING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GRANTS UNDER THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS MONITERED BY NEC'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, WHICH ENSURES THAT NEC MEETS THE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS OF TITLE 2 U.S. CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS (CFR) PART 200. NEC'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING EFFECTIVE INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF LAWS, REGULATIONS, CONTRACTS, AND GRANTS APPLICABLE TO FEDERAL PROGRAMS. ONLY CURRENT NEC STUDENTS IN GOOD STANDING ARE PROVIDED SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS OR OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO NEC COLLEGE STUDENTS ARE IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. ALL COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH NEC'S FINANCIAL AID SYSTEM. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S INTERNAL TUITION ACCOUNT AND REPRESENT AN OFFSET TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES ASSESSED BY NEC. PREPARATORY PROGRAM, CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAM AND SUMMER SESSION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TRACKED SEPARATELY AND ADMINISTERED THROUGH NEC'S STUDENT BILLING SYSTEM. PREPARATORY PROGRAM, CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAM AND SUMMER SESSION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S INTERNAL TUITION ACCOUNT AND REPRESENT AN OFFSET TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES ASSESSED BY NEC. GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO NEC STAFF AND THEIR ELIGIBLE SPOUSES AND DEPENDENTS ARE IN THE FORM OF STAFF TUITION WAIVERS, PURSUANT TO A WRITTEN BENEFITS PLAN. STAFF TUITION WAIVERS ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE CONSERVATORY'S BENEFITS SYSTEM AND, LIKE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS, ARE CREDITED TO THE INDIVIDUAL'S INTERNAL ACCOUNT TO OFFSET TUITION CHANGES. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES TO MONITOR GRANT USE ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON A NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS. AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TOWARDS A STUDENT'S TUITION, ROOM, AND BOARD COSTS, THEREBY ENSURING THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED. ADDITIONALLY, ANY ORGANIZATIONS AND ENTITIES RECEIVING SUBCONTRACT GRANTS FROM LOYOLA UNIVERSITY CHICAGO ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS ON THE USE OF THESE FUNDS. THESE PROGRESS REPORTS ARE MONITORED AND REVIEWED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE BEING USED APPROPRIATELY.

Budgeted amounts are awarded to eligible students who apply for financial aid (selected by committee or using packaging rules). Awarded students are checked to ensure that they are still eligible to receive these funds during the course of the academic year. The scholarships are applied directly to each student's account.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The organization has rules in place to ensure that scholarship aid provided to students is used for authorized purposes. Additional detail is available upon request.

ALL STUDENT AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE SYSTEM. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL AND OTHER DATA PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT AND VERIFIED, AS APPROPRIATE, BY THE UNIVERSITY. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT BASED ON STANDARDS FOUND IN THE UNIFORM GUIDANCE AND PERFORMED BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR DONOR-FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MOSTLY DETERMINED BY THE DONOR AND IS AVAILABLE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR FEDERAL AND STATE AID IS ALSO FOUND IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE INTERNET.

INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. ARE DEFINED AS THOSE LIVING IN THE U.S. AT THE TIME THE AID WAS AWARDED. THE ABOVE IS A BEST ESTIMATE BASED ON CERTAIN ASSUMPTIONS REGARDING WHERE PERSONS WERE LIVING WHEN THE AID WAS AWARDED AND DOES NOT REPRESENT THE DEGREE TO WHICH AID IS AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS.

Subrecipient grants - Lehigh University maintains a policy defining its procedures for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients who are performing a portion of a sponsored project externally awarded to Lehigh. The policy provides guidance to ensure that subrecipients conduct their portions of sponsored projects in compliance with laws, regulations, terms and conditions of awards and subawards, and that reimbursed costs incurred by subrecipients are allowed. Other Assistance - Undergraduate assistance offered from institutional funds to our undergraduate students is awarded on the basis of merit and/or financial need. The selection criteria is based on the calculated expected family contribution, which is derived by using complex formulas involving families' income, assets, and household sizes. The student financial aid office administers and monitors these grants using system-generated reviews, along with cross checks on an ad hoc basis. Results from these reviews are regularly evaluated. Subsequently, follow-up corrective actions are taken when appropriate, and potentially include award revisions or cancellations. These provisions are designed to help ensure that student assistance funds are awarded to eligible recipients, in accordance with applicable federal, state, institutional, and other program legislation, as well as relevant internal university policies and operational guidelines. Graduate assistance offered from institutional funds to our students consists of assistantships, fellowships and scholarships. Students can also apply for a variety of private, external fellowships and scholarships.

COE COLLEGE RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GRANTS FROM NSF, DEPT OF EDUCATION AND OTHER AGENCIES OR BRANCHES OF THE US GOVERNMENT. SEPARATE ACCOUNTS ARE USED FOR EACH GRANT TO MONITOR RECEIPTS AND DISBURSEMENTS. THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS APPROPRIATE ACCOUNTING AND INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES. ALL REQUIRED FINANCIAL REPORTING TO THE GRANT PROVIDER ARE COMPLETED TIMELY AND AUDITS BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM ARE DONE WHEN REQUIRED. THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY COMPLETES FILINGS REQUIRED BY UNIFORM GUIDANCE. DISTRIBUTIONS TO STUDENTS ARE MADE ACCORDING TO GRANT REQUIREMENTS.

AS PART OF OUR MISSION, SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON SELECTION BY A COMMITTEE UPON SUBMISSION OF AN APPLICATION TO BE USED TOWARDS THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON A TRIMESTER BASIS. ADDITIONALLY, TUITION LEVERAGE AWARDS ARE OFFERED BASED ON MERIT. THESE AWARDS ARE FOR TUITION ONLY AND FOLLOW THE STUDENT FOR THEIR PERIOD OF ENROLLMENT AS LONG AS THEY MAINTAIN GOOD STANDING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: BAPTIST MISSIONARY ASSOCIATION THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY UTILIZES A SPECIALIZED SOFTWARE PROGRAM TO TRACK THE USE OF FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. A PROSPECTIVE RECIPIENT APPLIES ONLINE THROUGH A GOVERNMENT WEB SITE WHO THEN SENDS THE INFORMATION TO THE SEMINARY. INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION IS VERIFIED INTERNALLY AND, BASED ON GUIDELINES IN THE FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID HANDBOOK, IT IS DETERMINED THE AMOUNT OF AID THE RECIPIENT QUALIFIES FOR. UPON RECEIPT OF THE FUNDS, PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY ESTIMATES THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FROM RECORDS MAINTAINED IN OUR FINANCIAL AID (SCHOLARSHIPS) AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE SYSTEM (GRADUATE RESEARCH ASSISTANCE STIPENDS AND FELLOWSHIPS) WHICH HAVE BEEN CLASSIFIED BY THE TYPE OF ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND OTHER STUDENT RELATED FINANCIAL AID MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM AUTHORIZED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

AS PART OF OUR MISSION, SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON SELECTION BY A COMMITTEE UPON SUBMISSION OF AN APPLICATION TO BE USED TOWARDS THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON A TRIMESTER BASIS. ADDITIONALLY, TUITION LEVERAGE AWARDS ARE OFFERED BASED ON MERIT. THESE AWARDS ARE FOR TUITION ONLY AND FOLLOW THE STUDENT FOR THEIR PERIOD OF ENROLLMENT AS LONG AS THEY MAINTAIN GOOD STANDING.

THE INSTITUTE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE INSTITUTE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED AS DIRECT REDUCTIONS TO TUITION COSTS AND NO FUNDS ARE REMITTED TO THE STUDENTS. SINCE THE STUDENT MAY NOT EXERCISE ANY PERSONAL DISCRETION AS TO HOW THE FUNDS ARE APPLIED, THE INSTITUTE IS NOT REQUIRED TO MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. RESEARCH FELLOWS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON THE QUALIFICATIONS IN THE AREA OF RESEARCH DETERMINED BY THE DIRECTOR OF THE CENTER FOR CULTURE AND SECURITY. GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON GRANT BUDGETS AND FUNDING AVAILABILITY. ONCE GRANTS ARE AWARDED, FUNDS ARE SPENT AT THE FELLOWS DISCRETION. PERIODIC UPDATES ARE REQUIRED AS DETERMINED BY THE GRANT AGREEMENT THAT STIPULATE OUTCOMES AND DELIVERABLES. ACADEMIC FELLOWS AND STUDENTS REQUESTING SCHOLARSHIPS APPLY TO IWP, AND ARE AWARDED FELLOWSHIPS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS ARE PROVIDED IN THE FORM OF STIPENDS TO RESIDENTS, POST-DOCTORAL AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. THE STIPENDS ARE SUBJECT TO ALL OF THE PAYROLL SYSTEM CONTROLS, TIME SHEETS, EFFORT REPORTING AND OTHER PAYROLL CONTROLS. THE REMAINING GRANTS USE TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS WHICH ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO TUITION AND FEES WITHIN THE ACCOUNTING SYSTEM TO WHICH THE STUDENT HAS NO ACCESS.

AFTER AN APPLICATION IS SUBMITTED BY THE STUDENT, FINANCIAL AID EVALUATES IT FOR NEED AND BASED ON THEIR ENROLLED COURSES, AND THIS IS RE-EVALUATED EACH YEAR AS NEED AND ENROLLMENT INDICATE. THE UNIVERSITY DOES MONITOR THE USE OF THE STUDENT AID AND IT IS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT BILLING ACCOUNT IN THE UNIVERSITY'S SIS (STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM).
PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MONITORED ANNUALLY BASED ON STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PROFILES AND GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form Sch I Part I Line 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANT SUBSTANTIATION THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND METHODOLOGIES FOR DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. FOR MERIT-BASED GRANTS, THE ORGANIZATION AWARDS THE GRANTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE STIPULATIONS OF THE UNDERLYING GOVERNING INSTRUMENT (I.E. DONOR ENDOWMENT AGREEMENTS, AND OTHER DONOR DOCUMENTATION). THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS OF COMPLIANCE FOR ALL GRANTS DISPERSED. ASSISTANCE TO MOREHOUSE COLLEGE STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED FOR THE PURPOSE OF AIDING WITH THE COST OF ATTENDING THE COLLEGE, I.E. FOR TUITION, HOUSING, AND MEALS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, NEED, AND OTHER DONOR REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS LOCATION OF RESIDENCE. MOREHOUSE COLLEGE HAS CRITERIA FOR THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS NEEDED TO AWARD A SCHOLARSHIP.

THE ADMISSIONS DEPT. ORIGINATES MERIT AWARDS AND DISCOVERY DAY DISCOUNTS FOR NEW STUDENTS, AND THE OFFICE OF DIVERSITY AWARDS THE DIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS. FINANCIAL AID WORKS WITH A SCHOLARSHIP COMM. TO EVALUATE APPLICATIONS AND SELECT RECIPIENTS FOR OTHER INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. NOTICES OF AVAILABLE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE POSTED OUTSIDE THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AS WELL AS VARIOUS INTERNAL PUBLICATIONS AND ON THE UNIVERSITY WEBSITE. RECORDS ARE MAINT. IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AND ALL AWARDS AND DISCOUNTS ARE POSTED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH FINANCIAL AID.

- The University maintains a formal policy defining its procedures for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients who are performing a portion of a sponsored project externally awarded to the University. The policy provides guidance to ensure that subrecipients conduct their portions of a sponsored project in compliance with laws, regulations and terms and conditions of awards and subawards and that reimbursed costs incurred by subrecipients are allowed. The policy addresses the roles and responsibilities of the central offices and academic departments of the University and describes the monitoring procedures for each area. The full text of the Universitys Subrecipent Policy is available online at the following web address http//financialservices.wustl.edu/wfin-topic/sponsored-projects-accounting/.

- The grants reported in Part III line 1 are scholarships to students. The use of scholarships is controlled by applying such amounts directly against balances owed by the student for tuition, fees and other qualifying educational expenses.

- The grants reported in Part III line 2 are fellowships awarded to students who may use them to pay qualified educational expenses or to support their living expenses while completing their course of study. The use of fellowship awards is not monitored by the University however an award is discontinued if the recipient student discontinues his/her course of study.

- Prizes and awards reported in Part III Line 3 are awarded to students or other individuals for, among other reasons, academic excellence, writing competitions, design competitions, research and service to the local community and other students.
SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 2: ANNA MARIA COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN TITLE IV FUNDING. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FAFSA FORM TO APPLY FOR AID.
THE STAFF COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL REQUESTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENSURE THAT EACH APPLICANT MEETS THE NECESSARY REQUIREMENTS.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY PRIMARILY CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED AND MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED UPON A NUMBER OF DIFFERENT CRITERIA, INCLUDING MERIT, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND FINANCIAL NEED. 1,299 STUDENTS RECEIVED FINANCIAL AID DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR FROM A COMBINATION OF ALL SOURCES (FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL). OF THE 1,299 STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID, 1,299 RECEIVED FUNDING FROM INSTITUTIONAL SOURCES.

THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL BUDGETED TO ACTUAL GRANT ACTIVITY IS MONITORED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AND THE FINANCIAL AID FOR EACH STUDENT IS APPROVED PRIOR TO DISBURSING FUNDS. GRANT REPORTING AND COMPLIANCE ARE MONITORED BY THE BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE ACCURACY.
CEDARVILLE UNIVERSITY AWARDS FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID POLICIES.

The financial aid office at Charleston Southern University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University. Scholarships are applied directly to student accounts.

LAFAYETTE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A POLICY DEFINING ITS PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SPONSORED FUNDS BY SUB-RECIPIENTS WHO ARE PERFORMING A PORTION OF A SPONSORED PROJECT EXTERNALLY AWARDED TO LAFAYETTE. THIS POLICY PROVIDES GUIDANCE TO ENSURE THAT SUB-RECIPIENTS CONDUCT THEIR PORTION OF SPONSORED PROJECTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF AWARDS AND SUB AWARDS, AND THAT REIMBURSEMENT COSTS INCURRED BY SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE ALLOWED.

THE COLLEGE CONSIDERS THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL AID (PRIMARILY GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, LOANS, AND WORK-STUDY) TO ITS STUDENTS, INCLUDING NON-RESIDENT ALIEN STUDENTS, TO BE A U.S. BASED ACTIVITY AS STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE ARE DEEMED TO BE LIVING IN THE UNITED STATES THROUGHOUT THEIR COMPLETION OF THE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CURRICULUM AND SUPPORTING PROGRAMS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ON THE BASIS OF MERIT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. THE SELECTION CRITERIA ARE BASED ON THE CALCULATED EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION, WHICH IS DERIVED BY USING COMPLEX FORMULAS INVOLVING FAMILIES' INCOME, ASSETS, AND HOUSEHOLD SIZES INCLUDING, AMONG OTHER FACTORS, DEPENDENTS IN COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ADMINISTERS AND MONITORS THESE AWARDS TO HELP ENSURE THAT THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS WELL AS RELEVANT INTERNAL COLLEGE POLICIES AND OPERATIONAL GUIDELINES. ACADEMIC PRIZES, AWARDS, FELLOWSHIP, AND INTERNSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A REVIEW BY THE APPLICABLE ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT. ALL AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AND ARE APPLIED TO BILLED CHARGES.
THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, WHICH DIRECTLY OFFSETS TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE COLLEGE'S ONLY GRANT-MAKING ACTIVITY IS TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO THOSE STUDENTS THAT MEET CERTAIN FINANCIAL AND MERIT CRITERIA. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DEDUCTED FROM EACH RECIPIENT'S BILL FOR TUITION AND FEES. AS SUCH, THE COLLEGE IS ASSURED THAT ITS GRANTS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE OF HELPING STUDENTS WITH EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES.

THE UNIVERSITY OF DENVER HAS A UNIVERSITY WIDE SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT ALLOCATION SYSTEM THAT DISTRIBUTES GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO ALL DIVISIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE PURPOSE AND ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA ARE ESTABLISHED AT THE FUND LEVEL. THE EXPENDITURE OF THIS FINANCIAL RESOURCE IS MONITORED THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE SOFTWARE SYSTEM WHICH ALLOWS FOR RECONCILIATION, ELIGIBILITY CHECKS, AND PREVENTS OVER EXPENDITURE. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO PARTICIPATES IN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AUDITS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN RECIPIENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO THE RECIPIENTS' TUITION AND FEE RECEIVABLE ACCOUNT AND IS APPLIED TO ANY OUTSTANDING CHARGES PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT OF ANY EXCESS AMOUNTS.

Regarding grants and assistance to students in the U.S.: the College determines the students' eligibility prior to releasing the grant, and then monitors their enrollment status and satisfactory academic progress.

FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED CONSISTENT WITH FEDERAL AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FEDERAL PROGRAMS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT. THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICES MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. VARIOUS CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - ALL GRANT-RELATED REVENUES AND EXPENSES AWARDED TO THE COLLEGE ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN SEPARATE AND DISTINCT RESTRICTED FUNDS WITHIN THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL SYSTEM. WITHIN THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE, A GRANT FILE IS ESTABLISHED FOR EACH RESTRICTED GRANT FUND WHICH CONTAINS THE GRANTOR-APPROVED BUDGET AND AWARD LETTER AMONG OTHER PERTINENT INFORMATION RELATED TO THE GRANTS, SUCH AS POLICIES OF THE GRANTOR. A FULL-TIME STAFF ACCOUNTANT IS ASSIGNED TO MONITOR THE EXPENDITURE OF THE GRANT FUNDS IN TERMS OF THE GRANT BUDGET, FUNDS AVAILABILITY AND ALLOWABILITY. FINANCIAL REPORTS ARE PREPARED BY THE STAFF ACCOUNTANT AND REVIEWED BY THE CONTROLLER PRIOR TO SUBMISSION TO THE GRANTING AGENCY. LAKE ERIE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MAINTAINS RECORDS TO COMPLY WITH GRANTOR'S CRITERIA FOR AWARDING FUNDS TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS. STUDENT INFORMATION IS REVIEWED AND MAINTAINED IN A POWERFAIDS DATABASE AND STUDENT FILES TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANTS.

Within the limits of available resources, the University makes every effort to make financial aid opportunities available to needy and academically eligible students. Students must be enrolled in full-time undergraduate or graduate degree programs to be considered for University academic scholarships, grants and/or need-based financial aid. With the exception of some academic scholarships and graduate aid, students who wish to apply for grants, loans, or work-study must submit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Awards are considered on the basis of financial need and/or a student's academic profile. Awards are packaged using a combination of grants and scholarships, loans, and work-study assignments. Students must be in good academic standing and achieve the minimum standards of academic progress. The University uses the College Board's PowerFaids software to manage our financial aid database and awarding procedures.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: AS GIFTS AND GRANTS ARE RECEIVED INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ARE ESTABLISHED IN OUR GENERAL LEDGER SYSTEM TO PROCESS THE GRANT REVENUE AND EXPENSE. A FINANCIAL MANAGER IS ASSIGNED TO REVIEW AND OVERSEE THE ACTIVITY OF THE FUND. IN ADDITION, OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE DEPARTMENTS ALSO PROVIDE SERVICES TO PROCESS, REPORT AND REVIEW THE GRANT INFORMATION. IN THE CASE OF PRIVATE GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS A FORMALIZED GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS TO VERIFY THAT THE UNIVERSITY UNDERSTANDS THE GRANT OBLIGATION AND PURPOSE BEFORE THE APPLICATION IS SENT TO THE GRANTOR ORGANIZATION. MANY PRIVATE AND GOVERNMENT GRANTS ARE RECEIVED FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. OUR ENROLLMENT SERVICES DEPARTMENT FOLLOWS A DETAILED POLICY AND PROCEDURES MANUAL THAT DESCRIBES HOW EACH SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED, INCLUDING SELECTION CRITERIA. THESE PROCEDURES FOLLOW GUIDELINES SET BY THE UNIVERSITY'S SENIOR LEADERSHIP. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS PROCESSED UNDER INDIVIDUAL GRANT FUNDS WITHIN OUR ACCOUNTING SYSTEM (AS DESCRIBED ABOVE), AND THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS ALSO PROCESSED UNDER EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. THIS APPROACH TO RECORD FINANCIAL AID BY FUND AND BY STUDENT ACCOUNT, PROVIDES A DETAILED RECORD OF HOW THE FUNDS ARE SPENT ACCORDING TO DONOR AND GOVERNMENTAL REQUIREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS STUDENT ACCOUNT ACTIVITY TO VERIFY THE STUDENT'S ENROLLMENT AND USE OF THE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO ESTABLISHED ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE EDUCATIONAL AND/OR CHARITABLE AND THE UNIVERSITY IS IN CONTACT WITH THOSE ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE THE GRANTS FUNDS ARE EXPENDED APPROPRIATELY.

PIT STAFF (BUSINESS OFFICE, GRANT ADMINISTRATOR, VICE PRESIDENT AND PROVOST) HAVE MONTHLY MEETINGS TO REVIEW GRANT DISBURSEMENTS. THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR GOES TO CONFERENCES AS SCHEDULED. WHEN THE GRANT IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS, THEN FINANCIAL AID AND STUDENT SERVICES VERIFY STUDENT ELIGIBILITY. THE BUSINESS OFFICE KEEPS COPIES OF ALL DISBURSEMENTS AND PROVIDES COPIES TO GRANT ADMINISTRATORS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE STAFF TRACK ALL SALARIES COVERED BY GRANTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 BALDWIN WALLACE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND MAKES NEED BASED FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ONLY TO ITS OWN ENROLLED STUDENTS. THE AWARDS CONSTITUTE PART OF THE COST OF ATTENDING. ADDITIONAL NEED-BASED AID USUALLY CONSISTS OF FEDERAL DIRECT STUDENT LOANS AND COLLEGE WORK STUDY FOR JOBS ON CAMPUS. THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAKES NEED-BASED GRANTS ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED USING NATIONALLY ACCEPTED FORMS AND METHODS. THE SAME OFFICE AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS USING BALDWIN WALLACE CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY DISBURSES THE GRANTS AS CREDITS TO STUDENT RECEIVABLE ACCOUNTS, OFFSETTING AMOUNTS BILLED FOR TUITION AND OTHER FEES.

THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES THE ELIGIBILITY OF ALL STUDENTS AT THE COLLEGE AND MAINTAINS APPROPRIATE RECORDS TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT PACKAGES AID BASED ON INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S NEED. ALL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS IS ELECTRONICALLY REPORTED TO THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE KEPT IN STORAGE FOR SEVEN YEARS. PREVIOUSLY UNFUNDED APPLICANTS FOR GRANT MONIES FROM BEREA COLLEGE APPALACHIAN FUND (BCAF) FOLLOW CRITERIA AND A FORMAT WHICH ARE CLEARLY STATED ON THE PROGRAM WEBSITE: HTTP://WWW.BEREA.EDU/APPALACHIANFUND/APPLYINGFORGRANT.ASP. PREVIOUSLY FUNDED APPLICANTS MUST PROVIDE A DETAILED REPORT ON THE USE OF THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S GRANT FUNDING. THIS FORMAT AND CRITERIA ARE LOCATED ON THE SAME LOCATION OF THE BCAF WEBSITE. IN ADDITION, THE BCAF SPONSORS A GRANTEE CONFERENCE EACH SPRING WHEN ALL GRANTEES FOR THAT YEAR MEET AND CONDUCT PUBLIC PRESENTATIONS OF THEIR GRANT FUNDED WORK. THE BCAF IS IN REGULAR CONTACT WITH GRANTEES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, VISITING EACH NEW GRANTEE AND REPEAT GRANTEES WHERE POSSIBLE. The staff of Grow Appalachia, including the director and two assistant directors, all individually review funding proposals from the potential partner sites for quality of programming, outreach activities and budget line items. This staff then meet as a group and discuss each proposal and either approve them as submitted, reject them out of hand, accept them conditionally asking for clarification or request more information to allow a sound decision. When the information requests are met the staff meet again and either accept or reject the proposal. Grow Appalachia also has an advisory board consisting of college and non-college members who are kept informed of Grow Appalachia's activities and program direction and who then offer advice and counsel for the program. FEDERAL, STATE, INSTITUTIONAL AND OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL INFORMATION GAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) THAT IS COMPLETED EACH YEAR. A THIRD-PARTY SOFTWARE VENDOR PROVIDES THE FEDERAL REGULATIONS BY WHICH GRANTS ARE GIVEN. THE FAFSA INFORMATION COMES FROM ELECTRONIC FILES WHICH ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED.ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS FOR GRANTS ARE STORED ELECTRONICALLY AND ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED. DISBURSEMENTS ARE REVIEWED DAILY TO INSURE ACCURACY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SATISFACTORILY FILL OUT A PRE-GRANT REQUEST APPLICATION CONFIRMING THE INTENDED USE OF THE FUNDS FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION. THE GRANTEE ALSO ACKNOWLEDGES IN WRITING THEREIN THE REQUIREMENT THAT ALL FUNDS BE USED FOR SUCH PURPOSES, PERIODIC REPORTING ON EXPENDITURES, AND THAT FUNDS WILL NEED TO BE RETURNED TO GRANTOR IF NOT USED OR TO BE USED IN FURTHERANCE OF THE CHARITABLE PURPOSE. THESE PROVISIONS OF THE APPLICATION COINCIDE WITH THE PRIVATE FOUNDATION EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF IRS REGULATIONS. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS MONITORED AS FOLLOWS: "FINANCIAL NEED" IS THE BASIS FOR ASSIGNING MOST INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP, BASED ON ANALYSIS OF FAMILY FINANCES FOR TUITION AFFORDABILITY. SOME INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED ON INTERN WORK EXCHANGE SOME INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED ON MERIT ASSIGNED FOR DIFFERENT PURPOSES FOR DIFFERENT SCHOLARSHIPS, FOR INSTANCE, A DONOR MAY SPECIFY SOME CRITERIA FOR SOME SPECIFIC DONATED SCHOLARSHIP.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Shore Health System works in close connection with the County Health Departments to ensure grants are used in support of common goals.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE RESULTS FROM FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONORS. INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID IS ALSO AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET SPECIFIC MERIT OR AFFILIATION CRITERIA. RECIPIENTS OF TUITION REMISSION AND EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FOR WILSON COLLEGE EMPLOYEES ARE VERIFIED FIRST BY THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES. RECIPIENTS OF TUITION EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FROM OTHER COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES ARE VERIFIED FIRST BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT.

MANOR COLLEGE AWARDS STUDENTS ATTENDING THE COLLEGE WITH SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. THE AWARDS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AT MANOR COLLEGE THEREFORE ENSURING THE PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS.

All students who are applying for Federal financial aid are required to complete the FAFSA and the Gordon-Conwell financial aid application. The information obtained from these documents is used by the Financial Aid Office to determine eligibility of Federal and institutional aid. To assist with determining their eligibility, each student is assigned an institutional budget for the cost of attendance. This budget includes tuition, books and fees, room and board, health insurance, transportation, and a miscellaneous category. In general, Gordon-Conwell scholarships are either need-based or merit-based and any Gordon-Conwell aid that is awarded is factored into the eligibility for Federal aid.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES. THE NC BUDGET OFFICE REQUIRES PERIODIC REPORTING FOR ALL GRANTS. THE REPORTING IS COMPLETED BY THE RESPONSIBLE DEPARTMENT AND THEN ENTERED INTO THE STATE WEBSITE BY THE CONTROLLER ANNUALLY.

PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A COMPUTERIZED SYSTEM WITH INTEGRATED CONTROLS TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED CRITERIA AS APPROVED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND FEDERAL AND STATE AUTHORITIES, AS APPROPRIATE. A SERIES OF REPORTS HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED AND ARE USED BY MANAGEMENT TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS ANY EXCEPTIONS. ANNUALLY, THE COLLEGES FINANCIAL AID COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL GUIDELINES IS AUDITED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE COLLEGE ISSUES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO ARE REQUIRED TO MATRICULATE AT THE COLLEGE. THE STUDENT DOES NOT HAVE ANY DISCRETION ON HOW FUNDS ARE USED; ALL FUNDS ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROGRAM, THEREFORE, THE COLLEGE IS NOT REQUIRED TO FURTHER MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. IN EACH CASE, THE COLLEGE IS AWARE OF THE CHARITABLE USE OF THE FUNDS, WHICH IS TYPICALLY FOR THE GENERAL PURSUIT OF THE RECEIVING ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSES AND NOT EARMARKED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. THE COLLEGE BELIEVES IN EACH INSTANCE THAT THESE FORMS OF ASSISTANCE ARE IN THE COLLEGE'S BEST INTEREST IN PROMOTING ITS IMAGE AND THE PURSUIT OF ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE.

RIPON COLLEGE TRACKS ALL GRANTS ISSUED BY GRANT, DOLLAR AMOUNT, STUDENT, AND TERM. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON THE GRANTEES ELIGIBILITY FOR ANY GRANT. ELIGIBILITY MAY BE BASED ON NEED, GRADES, MAJORS, ETC. IF NEED BASED, THE FAFSA WILL BE UTILIZED. EACH GRANT MAY HAVE UNIQUE SELECTION CRITERIA WHICH IS DOCUMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WHICH IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF APPLYING SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS, DONOR RESTRICTIONS ON ENDOWMENT INCOME TO BE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND INTERNAL POLICIES FOR INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS IN RELATION TO ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS.

MONITORING USE OF FUNDS The only grants made are to the students of Hastings college in the form of scholarships to assist in paying for education, grants were as follows: INSTITUTIONAL AID $17,689,317 STATE AID $283,658 PRIVATE SCHOLARSHIPS $494,241 TOTAL $18,467,216

CONCORDIA UNIVERSITY IRVINE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS ACCOUNTABLE FOR MONITORING AND DISBURSING ALL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

The College maintains complete records for the grants and scholarships provided to all individuals. Those records indicate the criteria used to award the grants, documentation supporting the grantee's eligibility of the award, and substantiation of the amounts awarded. Documentation is also maintained as to when and how the funds are utilized. Where appropriate, periodic reports are prepared, summarizing the allocation of funds, and a reconciliation of the amounts spent for each grant and scholarship. The College employs individuals whose primary responsibilities are to oversee the process of distributing financial grants and scholarships. The number of scholarship and grant recipients for the cost of attendance are tracked by the administrative system. The number of faculty and student recipients of research awards are estimated based on the type of grants awarded and the number of participants.
THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS THE GUIDELINES FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION

IT IS THE POLICY OF UPMC TO CONTRIBUTE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS AND AGENCIES THAT SUPPORT THE UPMC MISSION AND STRENGTHEN THE HEALTH AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF THOSE WHO LIVE AND WORK IN THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE.

Monitoring the use of grants to organizations in the US includes the following procedures: 1) obtain pre-award survey (for new grant recipients only); 2) obtain and review monthly or quarterly financial statements from recipients; 3) pay sub-recipient based on financial reports and operational cash-flow status of recipients; 4) review recipients' annual A-133 audit reports; 5) review programmatic reports from recipients; and 6) conduct monitoring and evaluation to assess sub-recipient performance. World Learning offers grants and scholarships to US students based on several criteria, including need and demonstrated commitment to the SIT's mission. Financial Aid Office awards financial aid to qualifying students based on several criteria and donors restrictions. Furthermore, in collaboration with Accounts Receivable office, Financial Aid office monitors financial aid disbursements throughout the year.

FINANCIAL AID DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE TO STUDENTS QUALIFYING FOR FINANCIAL GRANTS AND ARE BASED ON DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AS REPORTED THROUGH SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICE FOR FINANCIAL AID (SSSFA) APPLICATIONS. THEY ARE MONITORED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS.
ALL GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BY THE UNIVERSITY.

ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP APPROVAL AND DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
THE ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS WHICH ARE AWARDED ANNUALLY BASED ON THE STUDENTS MEETING CERTAIN GPA STANDARDS AND EXTENT OF NEED.
THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED AND ABILITY. BOTH ARE BASED ON SET CRITERIA.
ALL GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE PUBLIC CHARITIES THAT PUBLICLY REPORT ACTIVITIES VIA FORM 990

GANNON AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO FRESHMEN AND TRANSFER STUDENTS WHO MEET ELIGIBILITY STANDARDS FOR MERIT BASED AID SUCH AS ACADEMIC AND LEADERSHIP AWARDS. IN ADDITION, NEED-BASED AID IS CONSIDERED FOR STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED BY FILING THE REQUIRED APPLICATIONS AND ADHERING TO DEADLINES. AWARD PACKAGES ARE RENEWED EACH YEAR TO STUDENTS THAT REMAIN IN ACADEMICALLY GOOD STANDING AND CONTINUE TO MEET THE REQUIRED ELIGIBILITY STANDARDS FOR BOTH TYPES OF MERIT AND NEED-BASED AID. STUDENTS NEED NOT APPLY FOR SPECIFIC SCHOLARSHIPS SINCE THEY WILL AUTOMATICALLY RECEIVE CONSIDERATION FOR ALL FUNDS FOR WHICH THEY MAY BE ELIGIBLE WHEN THEY SUBMIT THE FAFSA.

LAKE TECHNICAL COLLEGE, INC. PREPARES ANNUAL BUDGETS AND MONITORS COSTS ON A MONTHLY BASIS. MOST DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DONE BY THE SCHOOL, WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF STATE-FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS REIMBURSED BY THE DISTRICT AFTER THE SCHOOL SUBMITS PURCHASE ORDERS AND OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION. THEREFORE, THERE IS ANOTHER LAYER OF REVIEW AND APPROVAL FOR ALLOWABLE COSTS.

The Organization provides grants/contributions to other organizations which are tax-exempt under IRC Section 501(c)(3) and governmental divisions that benefit the community and region through programs and activities.
ALL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS USED FOR TUITION AND FEES.

NEUMANN UNIVERSITY'S PROCESS FOR MONITORING FINANCIAL AID AND MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IS A COMBINATION OF PROCEDURES INVOLVING THE FOLLOWING OFFICES; FINANCIAL AID, INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT, REGISTRAR, AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARD SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ACCORDING TO THE SPECIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS OF THE SPECIFIC AWARD. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, REGISTRAR, AND BUSINESS OFFICE COORDINATE THE AWARDING AND DOCUMENTATION OF FINANCIAL AID TO INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY OF FINANCIAL AID, NOTIFICATION OF STUDENTS, CHANGE OF STATUS, AND RECONCILEMENT OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY VALIDATING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS COMPLETION OF EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

THE OFFICES OF ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL AID OVERSEE THE AWARDING OF BOTH NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID AND MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. ONCE A STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION PROCESS AND IS FOUND ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED AND/OR MERIT BASED AID, THE STUDENT WILL RECEIVE A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE DETAILING THE COMBINATION OF SOURCES USED TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. USAGE IS MONITORED BY VIRTUE OF DIRECT ACCOUNT POSTING.
Camper Scholarships are fee reductions awarded campers attending various camps in both NY and Fl. Scholarships given to Bible Institute students are fee reductions.
RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON A VARIETY OF FACTORS, SUCH AS FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE AND COURSE OF STUDY, AS STIPULATED BY THE AWARD/ENDOWMENT CRITERIA.

MARY LANNING HEALTHCARE ONLY MAKES CONTRIBUTIONS AND GRANTS TO CHARITABLE OR GOVERNMENTAL TAX EXEMPT ENTITIES. THE HOSPITAL VERIFIES THE TAX EXEMPT STATUS OF THE GRANT RECIPIENTS PRIOR TO MAKING THE GRANT. TERMS OF THE GRANT STATE THAT THE FUNDS ARE ONLY TO BE USED FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES.

ALLEN MEMORIAL HOSPITAL CORPORATION MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE STANDARD FINANCIAL POLICIES OF THE ORGANIZATION AND AS REQUIRED BY THE GRANT OR GRANTOR. THE POLICIES AND PROTOCOLS OF THE FUNDING SOURCE ARE ENFORCED AND MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATION AND REPORTED AS REQUIRED.

DRAKE UNIVERSITY HAS EMPLOYEES DEDICATED TO POST-AWARD REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE FOR ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE GRANTS RECEIVED. IN ADDITION, DRAKE RECEIVES AN A-133 AUDIT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS FROM THE EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. OUR FY19 A-133 AUDIT EXPRESSED AN UNQUALIFIED OPINION WITH NO FINDINGS, NO SIGNIFICANT DEFICIENCIES IN INTERNAL CONTROL, AND NO INSTANCES OF MATERIAL NONCOMPLIANCE.

DEPENDING ON THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE FUND SOURCES, FINANCIAL AID AND ALL TITLE IV AND STATE REGULATIONS ARE MONITORED, RECONCILED AND FOLLOWED DAILY BY TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED PROFESSIONAL STAFF THAT STAY UP TO DATE ON ANY CHANGES IN REGULATION THOUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TRAINING.

Schedule I, Part I, line 2 THE UNIVERSITY GRANTS LISTED ON SCHEDULE I REPRESENT SCHOLARSHIPS OFFERED TO STUDENTS WHO MATRICULATE AT THE UNIVERSITY. AS SUCH, NO MONITORING OF THE GRANT FUNDS ARE REQUIRED BECAUSE THE STUDENT MAY ONLY USE THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION.

VF AWARDS INTERNAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THE CADET'S GRADES (GPA) FROM HIS/HER PREVIOUS SCHOOL AND FINANCIAL NEED. THERE IS A MATRIX USED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT TO BE AWARDED TO EACH CADET. THERE ARE ALSO AID AWARDS WHICH ARE BASED ON SUBMITTED FAFSA FORMS. BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS HAVE CHARTS DETERMINING AID SUCH AS THROUGH PHEAA AND PELL GRANTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. AFTER A STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF MOUNT UNION, THEY MUST FILE A FAFSA. MOUNT UNION CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY IN THAT RESPECTIVE ORDER. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FURTHER ASSISTANCE, THE COLLEGE OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MAINTAINS RECORDS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS AWARDED TO NCU STUDENTS IN THE POWERFAIDS DATABASE. THIS SYSTEM TRACKS ENROLLMENT AND AID ELIGIBILITY AND ENSURES THAT STUDENTS ARE NOT AWARDED AID THAT EXCEEDS THEIR COST TO ATTEND COLLEGE. IN ADDITION THESE SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ALWAYS APPLIED TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT IN OUR ACCOUNTING SYSTEM TO ENSURE AWARDED FUNDS GO FIRST TO COVER TUITION AND OTHER INSTITUTIONAL CHARGES.

INITIAL MERIT AID FOR NEW FIRST YEAR AND TRANSFER FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS IS DETERMINED BY VARIABLES SUCH AS ACT TEST SCORES, HIGH SCHOOL GPA, TOP % OF HIGH SCHOOL CLASS, AND TRANSFER GPA. THIS INFORMATION IS DATA ENTERED INTO THE SOFTWARE AND THEN A FACTOR IS DETERMINED. THAT FACTOR DETERMINES THE MERIT AID THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. RULES IN THE SOFTWARE ALERT MANUAL AWARD ENTRY ERROR. RENEWAL OF MERIT AID IS DETERMINED AT THE TIME OF AWARDING THE AID FOR THE NEXT YEAR BY REVIEWING GRAND VIEW GPA AND SEMESTERS OF RECEIVED AID. AS A FOLLOW-UP FOR THOSE AWARDED PRIOR TO THE SPRING GRADES, A REPORT IS REVIEWED TO DETERMINE IF THE GPA CRITERIA WAS MET AT THE END OF THE TERM. GRAND VIEW IS A MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS AND OFFERS ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS IN BASEBALL, BASKETBALL, BOWLING, CROSS COUNTRY, FOOTBALL, GOLF, SOCCER, TRACK AND FIELD, WRESTLING, VOLLEYBALL, TENNIS AND SHOOTING SPORTS FOR MEN, AND BASKETBALL, BOWLING, COMPETITIVE DANCE, CROSS COUNTRY, GOLF, SOCCER, SOFTBALL, TRACK AND FIELD, VOLLEYBALL, TENNIS AND SHOOTING SPORTS FOR WOMEN. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ABILITY AS EVALUATED BY THE COACHES. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, INTERVIEW WITH AND BE RECOMMENDED BY THE COACH, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO THE UNIVERSITY. COACHES ARE GIVEN A BUDGET FOR THE YEAR TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN PLAYERS. APPEALS FOR ADDITIONAL DOLLARS ARE MONITORED BY THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR, ATHLETIC DIRECTOR, FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR, AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT. ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE ATHLETIC SUCCESS COORDINATOR AND THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR. COMMUNICATION OF STUDENT AWARDS IS DONE VIA EMAIL BETWEEN THE ATHLETIC ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR AND FINANCIAL AID. ART, MUSIC & THEATER AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO FULL TIME DAY STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE TALENT. TO QUALIFY, STUDENTS MUST VISIT CAMPUS, MEET WITH THE CHAIR OF THE DEPARTMENT, APPLY AND BE ACCEPTED TO GRAND VIEW. RENEWAL IS BASED ON GPA OR GOOD STANDING. EACH DEPARTMENT HAS A BUDGET TO USE TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN STUDENTS. COMMUNICATIONS FOR INITIAL AWARDS ARE GIVEN TO THE ADMISSIONS DIRECTOR AND FORWARDED TO THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR. ROSTERS OF THOSE TO RENEW ARE SENT TO THE CHAIR TO EVALUATE BASED ON GPA, ACADEMIC STANDING AND PARTICIPATION. BUDGETS ARE MONITORED BY FINANCIAL AID. AN ALERT WILL BE GIVEN IF AN AWARD IS ENTERED OVER THE BUDGETED AMOUNT. ANNUAL AND ENDOWED AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON DONOR QUALIFICATIONS. ADVANCEMENT, BUSINESS OFFICE, AND FINANCIAL AID SIGN OFF AND RECEIVE COPIES OF NEW FUNDS CREATED. THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID WORKS WITH THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND ADVANCEMENT TO DETERMINE WHICH FUNDS AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNT TO BE AWARDED IN A GIVEN YEAR IN JANUARY. NOTIFICATIONS GO TO DEPARTMENTS OF FACULTY PICKS. FINANCIAL AID PICKS ARE DETERMINED BY RUNNING A REPORT TO GET STUDENTS WHO MEET DONOR REQUIREMENTS. MOST OF THESE AWARDS REQUIRE A SCHOLARSHIP ACCEPTANCE AND THANK YOU TO THE DONOR. DISBURSEMENT RULES WILL NOT ALLOW THE FUND TO BE DISBURSED UNTIL THIS DOCUMENTATION IS RECEIVED. PACKAGING PROCEDURES ARE DEVELOPED EACH YEAR AND UTILIZED TO DETERMINE A STUDENT'S TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. IN THIS WAY, AID IS GIVEN IN A FAIR AND EQUITABLE MANNER.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

SCHOLARSHIP CANDIDATES MUST MEET BASIC MINIMUM GPA REQUIREMENTS, ATTEND IN FULL-TIME STATUS, AND MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN THEIR DEGREE PROGRAM. NEW STUDENTS COMPLETE AN APPLICATION ALONG WITH AN ESSAY. ALL ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES ARE INTERVIEWED BY AT LEAST TWO MEMBERS OF THE ADMISSIONS AND STUDENT AID COMMITTEE. AT THE END OF MARCH, THE COMMITTEE MEETS TO SELECT THE AWARD WINNERS. RETURNING STUDENTS WHO WERE NOT AWARDED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIP IF THEY MEET THE MINIMUM GPA REQUIREMENT IN THEIR STUDIES AT MTSO. THEY MUST PROVIDE THE ASAC SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WITH AN ESSAY AND TWO COURSE EVALUATIONS. THESE REVIEWS ALSO TAKE PLACE AT THE MARCH SCHOLARSHIP SELECTION MEETING. WE MONITOR THE ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND GPA OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. IF CRITERIA IS NOT MET, ONE SEMESTER OF SCHOLARSHIP PROBATION IS ENFORCED GIVING THE STUDENT AN ATTEMPT AT IMPROVEMENT BEFORE THE AWARD IS REVOKED.

STUDENTS QUALIFY FOR FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP, GRANTS, AND LOANS BASED ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL FAFSA APPLICATIONS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BASED ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE COLLEGE ARE SUBJECT TO ANNUAL AUDITS BY INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS IS THE NUMBER OF GRANTS AWARDED FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR.

The University enters into their computer system (POISE), as budgeted amounts, the amounts that the Department of Education has allocated to be awarded to eligible students. The Financial Aid Department prints out a fund report from POISE that shows the budget amount, how much has been awarded, and how much is available to be awarded. Then the Financial Aid Department awards to each student who has applied for financial aid and meets the University's qualifications, State, and federal guidelines for financial aid the amount that the student is eligible to receive. The amounts that the student receives are credited to their account at the University, then the University automatically deducts tuition, housing expenses, meal plan expenses, books, and University fees. If there is a balance remaining, it is then refunded to the student. The Financial Aid Department is audited each year by independent certified public accountants.

THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES AND INTERNAL NON-DISCRIMINATORY GUIDELINES FOR INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING. INSTITUTIONAL FUNDING IS BASED ON NEED, ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS AND INSTITUTIONAL PROGRAM NEEDS AND IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID, DEVELOPMENT, AND BUSINESS OFFICES TOGETHER ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. THREE DIFFERENT OFFICES ARE INVOLVED IN THE PROCESS FOR ADEQUATE CHECKS AND BALANCES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE VERIFIES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANTS AND AWARDS THE GRANT FUNDS. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE CLOSELY MONITORS THE RESTRICTIONS PLACED ON THE GRANT FUNDS FROM THIRD PARTIES. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE ENSURES THAT THE GRANTEES SELECTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FULFILL THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER THE RESTRICTIONS ON THESE GRANTS. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE USES INTERNAL REPORTS PROVIDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ASSIST WITH THIS PROCESS. THESE INTERNAL REPORTS PROVIDE BASIC DATA ON STUDENT ELIGIBILITY, SUCH AS MAJOR, GPA, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE REPORTS BACK TO THE APPROPRIATE GRANTORS CONCERNING THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE POSTS THE DISBURSEMENT OF GRANT FUNDS TO THE GENERAL LEDGER UPON RECEIVING CONFIRMATION FROM THE FINANCIAL AID AND DEVELOPMENT OFFICES. ALL GRANT INFORMATION IS KEPT ON A SECURE DATABASE. THIS DATABASE INCLUDES THE NAMES OF THE STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS, THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANTS, THE CRITERIA USED TO AWARD GRANTS, AND THE APPLICABLE SEMESTER AND ACADEMIC YEAR.

THE OFFICE OF ADVANCEMENT WORKS WITH DONORS TO ESTABLISH GUIDELINES FOR THE USE AND DISBURSEMENT OF ANY DONATED FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE DONORS' WISHES. THE DONORS' RESTRICTIONS ARE PUT IN WRITING WITH COPIES MAINTAINED IN THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE, THE CONTROLLER'S OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, IF APPLICABLE. IF THE DONATION IS FOR GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS TO BE DISTRIBUTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS A SPREADSHEET OF GRANT TITLES AND RESTRICTIONS WHICH ARE UPDATED AS NEEDED. A PERMANENT ELECTRONIC FILE IS ALSO MAINTAINED. THE GRANTS OR SCHOLARSHIPS ARE "MATCHED" WITH AN ELIGIBLE RECIPIENT BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE FINAL STEP IN THE PROCESS IS A RANDOM AUDIT CONDUCTED ONCE A YEAR BY AN OUTSIDE AUDIT FIRM. NEED-BASED GRANTS WERE AWARDED TO WARREN WILSON COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED ON FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID) RESULTS. FAFSA RESULTS WERE NOT REQUIRED TO BE CONSIDERED FOR MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, BUT MANY OF THESE DOLLARS WERE USED TO MEET THE FEDERAL DEFINITION OF "NEED".

The University provides funding to faculty and students for scholarships, research and other projects. Expenses must be substantiated under the Accountability Plan to ensure proper use of funds. Students must meet the requirements specified in the respective award program in order to receive the award. The requirements include criteria such as financial need, obtaining/maintaining the required grade point average and studying in a certain economic discipline, etc. If the scholarship is ongoing, the student must continue to meet the scholarship requirements in order to be awarded a scholarship in subsequent years. Financial need, grade point averages and other scholarship criteria are continually monitored to determine whether the student meets the criteria.

Grants and Scholarships Monitored by MidAmerica Nazarene University: Institutional- Awarded based on financial need, merit, and donor criteria. Amounts will vary depending on awards and funding limits. The Student Financial Aid Services Office monitors the student progress towards their educational goal to ensure compliance with institutional polices. Students failing to meet the institutional polices risk loss of institutional aid. Federal and State- Awarded based on Federal and State regulations, based on financial need, academic standards of the programs, and funding availability. The Student Financial Aid Services Office monitors the student progress towards their educational goal to ensure compliance with Federal and State polices. Students failing to meet the Federal and State polices risk loss of Federal and State aid. Employee Tuition Scholarship- Eligible employees and family members can apply for tuition scholarships (tuition remission). The amount is based on title, length of employment, and other institutional aid. All grants and scholarships are applied directly to student accounts.

DURING FISCAL YEAR 2019, HILLSDALE COLLEGE AWARDED MONETARY GRANTS/PRIZES TO ONE INSTITUTION BASED ON SPECIFIED CRITERIA. ONE GRANT IS THE HENRY SALVATORI PRIZE FOR EXCELLENCE IN TEACHING, WHICH HONORS ONE K-12 SCHOOL EACH YEAR FOR ITS OUTSTANDING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM. ALL PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOLS WHOSE TEACHING REFLECTS THE BEST TRADITIONS OF WESTERN EDUCATION ARE WELCOME TO APPLY. THE WINNING SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO PREPARE AN ANNUAL REPORT ON THE EXPENDITURE(S) OF THE PRIZE UNTIL SUCH FUNDS ARE ENTIRELY EXPENDED. ONE OTHER GRANT SUPPORTED ONE OF THE TWENTY CLASSICAL K-12 CHARTER SCHOOLS AFFILIATED WITH HILLSDALE'S BARNEY CHARTER SCHOOL INITIATIVE. THE INITIATIVE GUIDES FOUNDING GROUPS IN OBTAINING A CHARTER AND PROVIDES CURRICULAR SUPPORT AND TEACHER AND PRINCIPAL TRAINING. THIS GRANT SUPPORTED THE LAUNCH OF THE CHARTER SCHOOL. THE RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE HILLSDALE COLLEGE DOCUMENTATION ON THE USE OF THE FUNDS, AND HILLSDALE COLLEGE STAFF VISIT THE SCHOOLS EACH YEAR.

LAGRANGE COLLEGE AWARDS BOTH MERIT-BASED (NON-NEED-BASED) AND NEED-BASED AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS. MERIT-BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, LEADERSHIP, AND TALENT. NEED-BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY FAMILY INCOME AND ASSET INFORMATION REPORTED ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BY A REVIEW 0F A STUDENT'S COMPLIANCE WITH SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS, GRADE POINT AVERAGE FOR THE CONTINUATION OF MERITBASED AID, AND SUBMISSION OF A RENEWAL FAFSA IN AWARDING 0F NEED-BASED AID. THERE WERE 841 STUDENTS AWARDED INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IN 2018-2019.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS AnnuallY tuition discount expenditures are projected and budgeted for the upcomiNg budget cycle. Projections are prepared by the Director of Student Administrative Services, delivered to the Director of Budget and submitted for approval to the Executive Vice President of Finance and the Board of Trustees. Various constituencies across campus are "allocated" a certain amount of funding to award to students, within the budgeted amounts. These awards are submitted to the Executive Vice President of Finance for approval and then routed to the Director of Student Administrative Services who then, through the Director of Financial Aid, oversees the packaging of these awards and integration with other financial aid awards to insure that no students with federal financial aid are over-awarded. Since these awards are tuition-based, they are posted to students' accounts each quarter once schedules are locked and total tuition amounts can be verified by the Director of Student Accounts and staff. Quarterly, the Director of Student Administrative Services compares actual expenses to budgeted amounts and alerts the budget manager of any potential overages. The budget is reviewed in each case to make sure overages will not cause fiscal issues. If it appears that they will, adjustments are recommended by the Director of Budget to the Executive Vice President of Finance.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ISSUED AND AMOUNTS ARE USED TO OFFSET STUDENT TUITION.

GRANTS GIVEN TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE TO FURTHER EDUCATION, HEALTHCARE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN THE AREAS SURROUNDING THE ORGANIZATION. ALL GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO ORGANIZATIONS WITH BOARDS CONSISTING OF CIVIC, PHILANTHROPIC AND BUSINESS LEADERS WHO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANTS AND ENSURE THEY'RE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES. SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TOWARDS THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS TO OFFSET TUITION COSTS TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED ONLY FOR STUDENT EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

TRINITY PARTICIPATES IN THE FEDERAL TITLE IV FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS, AND FOLLOWS THE PROCEDURES PRESCRIBED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION RELATED TO THE DISBURSEMENT OF TITLE IV FUNDS, INSTITUTIONAL AWARDS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS AND ASSISTANCE FROM OTHER SOURCES. THESE PROCEDURES INCLUDE ENSURING THAT STUDENTS COMPLETE A FAFSA EACH ACADEMIC YEAR, COMPLETING THE VERIFICATION REQUIREMENTS, CALCULATING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, AND ENSURING THAT STUDENTS WHO WITHDRAW OR STOP ATTENDING ARE REVIEWED AND HANDLED AS PRESCRIBED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.
