THE ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT EXECUTIVE SERVES AS THE SCHOLARSHIP REVIEW COMMITTEE IN REVIEWING AND DETERMINING THE AWARDS. THE DOCERE AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT AND NEED. THE TOLEE TOTUM AWARDS ARE ALSO BASED ON NEED AND AN ESSAY WHERE APPLICANTS IDENTIFY WHAT THE PRACTICE OF NATUROPATHIC MEDICINE MEANS TO THEM AND HOW A GRANT AWARD WOULD AID THEM IN REACHING THEIR EDUCATIONAL GOALS. WHEN ESTABLISHING THESE GRANT AWARDS, THE ORGANIZATION SEEKS TO REWARD STUDENTS WHO HAVE ACHIEVED HIGH ACADEMIC SUCCESS AS WELL AS THOSE WHO WILL BENEFIT THE MOST FROM THE GRANT AWARD. AS STATED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S COURSE CATALOG, THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, DISABILITY, SEX, RELIGION, AGE, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, OR MARITAL STATUS IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF EDUCATIONAL AND ADMISSION POLICIES, FINANCIAL AID, EMPLOYMENT OR ANY OTHER PROGRAM OR ACTIVITY. THIS STATEMENT APPLIES TO THE AWARDING OF SCNM SCHOLARSHIPS.

INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED BASED ON BOTH A FINANCIAL NEED AND MERIT BASIS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS AND THE USE OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA AND THE INSTITUTIONAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA. MERIT AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET CERTAIN ACADEMIC CRITERIA WHO MAY OR MAY NOT ALSO HAVE FINANCIAL NEED FOR ASSISTANCE. CAMPUS BASED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM FEDERAL AND STATE SOURCES IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AS STIPULATED BY FEDERAL OR STATE GUIDELINES. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS AND THE USE OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON SPECIFIC CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY, STUDENT SELECTION AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP. EACH SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT WILL BE MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO CONFIRM THAT THEY HAVE SATISFIED ALL SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT.
Grants are administered through the Office of Financial Aid for all Federal, State and Institutional aid programs, and reconciled by the Business Office.

IN PROVIDING FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS, THE COLLEGE ADHERES TO FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES AS WELL AS INTERNAL CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC PROGRESS, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED FOR PARTICULAR SCHOLARSHIPS. THE FEDERAL FAFSA FORM IS USED. STUDENT ACCOUNTS ARE DIRECTLY CREDITED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED AND THEREFORE, NO CASH IS EXCHANGED.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN POLICIES REGARDING THE AWARDING OF SPECIFIC GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS. SELECTION CRITERIA AND ELEGIBILITY IS DETERMINED BASED ON THE TYPE, PURPOSE, AND/OR RESTRICTION OF THE AWARD. AWARDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. THE ALLOCATION OF GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS AND MUNICIPALITIES IS DETERMINED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION AND TREASURER. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. ELIGIBILITY FOR BOWDOIN GRANT ASSISTANCE IS "NEED BASEDDETERMINED THROUGH ANALYSIS OF A FAMILY'S INCOME AND ASSETS. FAMILY INFORMATION IS COLLECTED THROUGH THE COLLEGE BOARD'S CSS/FINANCIAL AID PROFILE FORM, FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND THE FAMILY'S FEDERAL INCOME TAX RETURNS. EXCEPT FOR NATIONAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT OFFER MERIT BASED AID. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A STUDENT AID OFFICE TO COUNSEL STUDENTS/FAMILIES ON HOW TO AFFORD A BOWDOIN EDUCATION AND TO ENSURE THAT AWARDS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ESTABLISHED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: INDIVIDUALS REQUESTING ANY FORM OF FINANCIAL AID MUST COMPLETE PERSONAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND IF THEY'RE DEPENDENTS, THEY MUST ALSO PROVIDE PARENTAL OR GUARDIAN FINANCIAL INFORMATION. ONLY INDIVIDUALS ENROLLED IN THE SCHOOL AT THE TIME OF DISBUSEMENTS ARE CONSIDERED FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS MAY ONLY BE USED TO DEFRAY THE EDUCATIONAL COSTS OF MARTICULATING AT THE COLLEGE. NO STUDENT MAY DEFRAY SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR PERSONAL MATTERS; ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT UNDERTAKE FURTHER MONITORING ONCE THE SCHOLARSHIP IS AWARDED.
ALL STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE POSTED TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND PAY FOR TUITION AND FEES. PER OTIS POLICY, BFA/MFA SCHOLARSHIPS DO NOT EXCEED TUITION AND FEES.

Olin College provides all accepted students with merit scholarships which cover half of their tuition and are credited directly to their student accounts. The scholarships are only used to offset tuition charges. The College provides assistance to certain not-for-profit organizations that support the College and/or have similar beliefs. The assistance is considered a donation.

GRANT MONITORING PROCESS FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS BASED ON THE GENERAL CRITERIA FOR INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID. GPA AND ENROLLMENT ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THESE CRITERIA ARE MET.
STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

ACADEMIC AWARDS ARE MONITORED AT THE TIME OF ADMISSION. ALL STUDENTS ARE REVIEWED FOR ACADEMIC AWARD ELIGIBILITY. THE SAME CRITERIA IS USED FOR ALL STUDENTS, INTERNATIONAL OR NOT. IF STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE THEY ARE NOTIFIED ALONG WITH THEIR OFFER OF ADMISSION. RENEWAL IS BASED, AMONG OTHER THINGS, ON CUMULATIVE GPA, RESIDENTIAL STATUS, ETC. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE IN ADDITION TO ACADEMIC AWARDS AND ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE SPORT, NCAA STANDARDS, INTERNAL FUNDS AVAILABILITY, AND NEGOTIATIONS BETWEEN THE COACH AND ATHLETE.

STUDENTS AWARDED WITH AN HONOR SCHOLARSHIP MUST BE PART OF THE UNIVERSITY'S HONOR PROGRAM AND THIS PROGRAM HAS SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS THAT THE STUDENTS MUST MEET EVERY TRIMESTER IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS AWARDED WITH AN ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIP MUST MEET CERTAIN REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED BY THE ATHLETIC DEPARTMENT. STUDENTS ARE SELECTED BY A COMMITTEE PART OF THE VICE PRESIDENCY OF STUDENTS AFFAIRS.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE INSTITUTE ENSURES THAT ITS GRANTS OF FINANCIAL AID ARE USED BY STUDENTS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES BY CREDITING THE AID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS OR THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID COMPLIANCE PROCESS. THE INSTITUTE ALSO PROVIDES FUNDING FOR TRAVEL EXPENSES, WHICH HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE TOTAL ABOVE, FOR A SMALL NUMBER OF STUDENTS WHOSE PROJECT PROPOSALS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT.

SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS THROUGH FINANCIAL AID, BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND FEDERAL OR STATE MANDATED REGULATIONS. DONOR RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND DISTRIBUTED THROUGH FINANCIAL AID PROCESSES TO COVER EDUCATIONAL EXPENSES ESTIMATED OR CHARGED BY THE UNIVERSITY.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS SET PROCEDURES IN MONITORING AND DETERMINING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. ELIGIBLE STUDENTS ARE CHOSEN AS GRANT RECIPIENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

PART I, LINE 2 ONE OF THE UNIVERSITY'S HIGHEST PRIORITIES IS TO REMAIN AFFORDABLE AND ACCESSIBLE TO THE MOST TALENTED STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF THEIR FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. THE UNIVERSITY'S ADMISSION PROCESS FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS FROM THE UNITED STATES IS NEED-BLIND, WHICH MEANS THAT STUDENTS ARE ADMITTED IRRESPECTIVE OF THEIR ABILITY TO PAY; THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES THE FINANCIAL AID NECESSARY TO MAKE STANFORD AFFORDABLE TO EVERY ADMITTED STUDENT. FOR INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS, THE UNIVERSITY IS NEED-AWARE: STANFORD ANALYZES THE NEED FOR AID AND AIMS TO MEET THE DETERMINED NEED. SINCE 2000, THE UNIVERSITY HAS CONTINUED TO ENHANCE ITS FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS FOR BOTH ITS UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. CURRENTLY, FAMILIES OF UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS FROM THE U.S. WITH INCOMES BELOW $150,000 AND ASSETS TYPICAL OF THAT INCOME LEVEL RECEIVE AT LEAST ENOUGH SCHOLARSHIP TO COVER THE COST OF TUITION. THOSE WITH INCOMES BELOW $65,000 AND TYPICAL ASSETS RECEIVE ENOUGH SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO COVER TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD, AND OTHER EXPENSES. IN FY19, APPROXIMATELY 48% OF UNDERGRADUATES WERE AWARDED NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID FROM STANFORD. STANFORD PROVIDES VALUABLE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO ELIGIBLE GRADUATE STUDENTS WHICH ENABLES THEM TO PURSUE THEIR ADVANCED STUDIES. FUNDING MAY TAKE DIFFERENT FORMS, SUCH AS FELLOWSHIPS AND ASSISTANTSHIPS, AND THESE IN TURN FURTHER THEIR GRADUATE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND PROGRESS TO DEGREE COMPLETION. IN THE CASE OF GRADUATE RESEARCH AND TEACHING ASSISTANTSHIPS AS WELL AS FELLOWSHIPS, THE FUNDING COVERS PART OF STANFORD'S TUITION (WHICH IS FREE OF INCOME TAX), IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING A STIPEND OR SALARY THAT HELPS STUDENTS WITH THEIR LIVING EXPENSES. BOTH COMPONENTS ARE ESSENTIAL FOR DOCTORAL STUDENTS IN PARTICULAR, AS IT TAKES SEVERAL YEARS TO GAIN THEIR MASTERY OF SPECIALIZED SKILLS AND CONTENT KNOWLEDGE IN THEIR CHOSEN FIELDS. GRADUATE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AND OTHER SUPPORT IS AWARDED BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT AND THE AVAILABILITY OF AID. IN THE FACE OF DIMINISHING FEDERAL SUPPORT, STANFORD HAS ASSUMED MORE OF THE FINANCIAL WEIGHT OF SUPPORTING ITS GRADUATE STUDENTS. IN FY19, APPROXIMATELY 81% OF GRADUATE STUDENTS RECEIVED FINANCIAL SUPPORT. THE KNIGHT-HENNESSY SCHOLARS PROGRAM IS AN ADDITIONAL SOURCE OF GRADUATE STUDENT SUPPORT. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES FULL FUNDING FOR THREE YEARS TO ENABLE GRADUATE STUDENTS TO PURSUE ADVANCED DEGREES AND DEVELOP THE CAPACITY TO LEAD AND BRING ABOUT POSITIVE CHANGES IN THE WORLD. THE TOTAL FINANCIAL AID INCLUDES $322,056,511 IN MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS. AN ADDITIONAL $179,470,712 REFLECTS AMOUNTS PAID FOR ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STUDENTS, INCLUDING PAYMENTS FOR HEALTH INSURANCE, LIVING EXPENSES, AND SUPPORT OF POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWS. THESE AMOUNTS INCLUDE $202,559 IN GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. GRANTS LISTED IN PART II ARE PRIMARILY GRANTS MADE FROM DONOR ADVISED FUNDS MANAGED BY STANFORD AND ARE BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS BY DONORS OF THOSE FUNDS AND REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY SENIOR OFFICIALS IN THE UNIVERSITY OFFICE OF DEVELOPMENT. SUB-GRANTS STANFORD OCCASIONALLY RECEIVES GRANT SUPPORT THAT IS DISBURSED TO OTHER INDIVIDUALS OR ENTITIES PER THE TERMS OF THE AWARD. IN MOST CASES, PRIOR TO THE GRANT TO STANFORD, THE UNIVERSITY WILL PROVIDE THE GRANTING ENTITY WITH A LIST OF SUCH CONTEMPLATED RECIPIENTS. GENERALLY, AS WORK ON THE GRANT PROGRESSES, CHANGES TO THESE RECIPIENTS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE GRANTING AGENCY. DUE TO THESE REVIEW REQUIREMENTS OF THE GRANTING AGENCY, STANFORD DOES NOT REPORT SUCH PAYMENTS ON FORM 990, SCHEDULE I.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 2: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: THE FILING ORGANIZATION IS PART OF THE INTEGRATED HEALTHCARE SYSTEM OPERATED BY NOVANT HEALTH, INC. ("NOVANT HEALTH"), THE PARENT ORGANIZATION. NOVANT HEALTH'S BYLAWS AUTHORIZE IT TO ESTABLISH CERTAIN POLICIES FOR ALL OF ITS SUBSIDIARIES WITHIN THE SYSTEM. NOVANT HEALTH HAS ESTABLISHED A SYSTEM-WIDE CORPORATE POLICY WITH STANDARDIZED GUIDELINES THAT ARE TO BE USED IN REVIEWING THE ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION OF GRANTEES RECEIVING CERTAIN EXEMPT PURPOSE FUNDS. THE FILING ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS DOCUMENTATION OF THE ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA AND RECORDS OF THE AMOUNTS ARE MAINTAINED VIA THE GENERAL LEDGER. FUNDS ARE GENERALLY NOT TRACKED AFTER BEING GRANTED, AS THE ORIGINAL ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA HAVE ALREADY BEEN MET.

Scholarships are monitored through the financial aid office, to ensure that all scholarship monies are used for housing, tuition, meals and books. No cash changes hands and funds are directly tied to student accounts.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND LOANS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED (AS DETERMINED BY A STANDARDIZED FINANCIAL AID FORM), ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR LEADERSHIP. RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON OBJECTIVE CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF SEX, RACE, COLOR, OR NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF ITS FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. ANY ESTIMATES UTILIZED ARE BASED ON CALCULATED AVERAGE AWARDS EXTENDED TO COMPARABLE GROUPS. ALL AWARDS ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY TO THE UNIVERSITY AND NOT TO THE RECIPIENT.
The organization utilizes financial aid software and a monitoring system to ensure that aid is awarded properly according to university, state, and federal guidelines.
CHECK REQUEST AND PURCHASE ORDERS ARE REVIEWED FOR APPROPRIATE AUTHORIZATION AND USE OF FUNDS PRIOR TO ISSUANCE OF PAYMENT. RGH ONLY MAKES CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, PERSONAL PRESENTATION SKILLS AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A MINIMUM GPA OF 2.5 TO QUALIFY FOR CONSIDERATION FOR ANY ADDITIONAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING.

STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF NEED AND ELIGIBILITY FOR SPECIFIC AWARDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY DONOR STIPULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND FOR MONITORING ONGOING ELIGIBILITY (E.G. MAINTENANCE OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS).
STUDENTS ARE VERIFIED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND FUNDS ARE POSTED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. ACCOUNT IS REFUNED IF NOT USED IN SPECIFIED TIME OR IF STUDENT WITHDRAWS.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY FOR STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE UNIVERSITY AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO HAVE COMPLETED THE COLLEGE'S ADMISSIONS REQUIREMENTS AND HAVE REGISTERED FOR CLASSES. SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRE A STUDENT TO MAINTAIN A FULL-TIME STATUS THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER AND ARE AWARDED FOR ONE YEAR, DIVIDED EVENLY BETWEEN THE FALL AND SPRING SEMESTERS. MOST SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RENEWED ANNUALLY AS LONG AS THE STUDENT MEETS THE RENEWAL CRITERIA AND COMPLETES THE FAFSA. MUSIC AND ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRE RE-EVALUATION EACH YEAR AND ARE NOT AUTOMATICALLY RENEWED. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT A STUDENT WILL COMPLETE THE SEMESTER FOR WHICH THE AWARD IS RECEIVED. A STUDENT MUST BE IN GOOD STANDING AND MAKING SATISFACTORY PROGRESS IN ORDER TO RECEIVE A SCHOLARSHIP.

THE UNIVERSITY ABIDES BY THE REGULATORY PROVISIONS SET ASIDE IN ALL GRANT AWARDS TO ENSURE PROPER FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC REPORTING. THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS (OSP) PROVIDES OVERSIGHT AND MONITORING OF ALL GRANTS. OSP RECEIVED MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, AND ANNUAL REPORTS FROM ALL GRANTS FUNDED PROJECT DIRECTORS (PD) AND PROJECT INVESTIGATORS (PI) ASSOCIATED WITH THE IMPLEMENATION OF THE GRANT AWARDS. OSP MEETS WITH THE PDS AND PIS WEEKLY TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS ARE ON TARGET FOR COMPLETION. OSP WORKS CONJUNCTIVELY WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCE TO MONITOR AND RECONCILE ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS WITHIN GRANTS AND CONTRACTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 1:CRITERIA FOR RECEIVING A SCHOLARSHIP THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY
ExplntnTxt: THE MAIN DETERMINANT OF FINANCIAL AID IS NEED, AND ONE OF THE MAJOR ELEMENTS IN THE NEED EQUATION IS THE COST OF ATTENDING SCHOOL. STUDENTS HAVE DIFFERENT BUDGETS, DEPENDING ON WHETHER THE STUDENT LIVES ON OR OFF CAMPUS. STUDENT EXPENSE BUDGETS INCLUDE THE COST OF TUITION AND FEES, BOOKS AND SUPPLIES, A MONTHLY ALLOWANCE FOR ROOM AND BOARD, TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM SCHOOL, AND PERSONAL EXPENSES SUCH AS CLOTHES AND ENTERTAINMENT. ALL STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE FAFSA, REGARDLESS OF INCOME, BEFORE NEED CAN BE DETERMINED. ONCE THE FAFSA IS COMPLETED AND THE RESULTS ARE RECEIVED AT THE INSTITUTION FROM THE FEDERAL CENTRAL PROCESSOR, THE INSTITUTION WILL USE THE EFC (EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION) TO AWARD FINANCIAL AID.

DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED WHICH SUBSTANTIATES ELIGIBILITY AND THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO STUDENTS. NEED BASED ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED USING VARIOUS FACTORS TO ASSESS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF THE STUDENT.

AS A PRIVATE TRUST FOR THE PUBLIC GOOD, MAYO IS DEDICATED TO GIVING BACK TO THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH ITS EMPLOYEES LIVE AND WORK. MAYO INVESTS RESOURCES RESPONSIBLY TO PRODUCE THE BEST OUTCOMES FOR PATIENT CARE, EDUCATION, RESEARCH, COMMUNITY ENRICHMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY. GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND PRIORITIZED IN HOW THEY: - ADDRESS SIGNIFICANT AND EMERGENT COMMUNITY NEEDS - ALIGN WITH MAYO'S MISSION - IMPROVE HEALTH OF INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY - DEMONSTRATE PARTNERSHIP AND COLLABORATION BUILDING - ENABLE LONG TERM CAPACITY BUILDING AND SUSTAINABILITY MONITORING OF GRANTS GIVEN IS DEPENDENT ON TYPE. LARGER MULTI-YEAR AND CAPITAL GRANTS ARE MONITORED FOR ACHIEVEMENT OF STATED GOALS WITHIN THE GRANT AGREEMENT. SINGLE-YEAR OPERATIONAL AND PROGRAMMATIC GRANTS ARE NOT MONITORED AFTER THE FUNDS HAVE BEEN DISBURSED; HOWEVER, ADDITIONAL FUNDING REQUESTS ARE CONSIDERED BASED ON USE AND OUTCOMES OF PREVIOUSLY AWARDED GRANTS. TRANSFERS OR GRANTS TO TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS AND/OR AFFILIATED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS WILL BE USED PURSUANT TO THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS AND TO FURTHER THE EXEMPT PURPOSES OF THE GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS. BOTH THE FILING ORGANIZATION AND THE GRANTEE ORGANIZATION MAINTAIN ADEQUATE BOOKS AND RECORDS OF SUCH TRANSFERS OR GRANTS. NO ADDITIONAL MONITORING IS PERFORMED. FEDERAL AWARDS THAT ARE SUBCONTRACTED TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ARE MONITORED BY MAYO AS PRESCRIBED IN OMB SINGLE AUDIT (FKA CIRCULAR A-133). MAYO PROVIDES SHORT-TERM FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO EMPLOYEES EXPERIENCING TEMPORARY HARDSHIPS. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED BASED ON A PROVEN NEED AND ARE NOT MONITORED. MEDICAL STUDENT STIPENDS ARE MOSTLY PAID TO THE STUDENTS OF THE MAYO CLINIC COLLEGE OF MEDICINE AND SCIENCE TO HELP OFFSET THE COST OF THE STUDENT'S LIVING EXPENSES AND ARE NOT MONITORED. MAYO CLINIC'S SCHOOLS OFFER BOTH MERIT-BASED AND NEEDS-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS THAT ARE CONTINGENT UPON ON-GOING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.
PRIOR TO AWARDING ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS, AN ASSESSMENT IS MADE ON THE USE OF THE FUNDS. FINAL DETERMINATION IS BASED ON WHETHER FUNDS WILL BE USED TO FURTHER OUR MISSION.

GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS THAT ATTEND ONE OF THE COMPANY'S COLLEGES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE APPLICATIONS FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS SUBMITTED BY STUDENTS OR PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS, COMPARES THE APPLICATIONS WITH THE WRITTEN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AND DETERMINES IF THE APPLICANT IS ELIGIBLE AND THEN APPROVES OR REJECTS AN APPLICATION. A WRITTEN RECORD OF THE APPROVALS AND THE AMOUNTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS MAINTAINED. THE ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENTS ARE THEN NOTIFIED OF THE AMOUNT OF ANY SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED AND A PRO RATA PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT ON A MONTHLY BASIS. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM THE COLLEGE, THE UNUSED PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CANCELLED.

YALE NEW HAVEN HOSPITAL ("YNHH") CARRIES OUT DUE DILIGENCE IN PROVIDING MONETARY ASSISTANCE ONLY TO QUALIFYING 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS THAT COMPLEMENT ITS MISSION OR SUPPORT THE GREATER GOOD IN THE COMMUNITIES SERVED. NONE OF THE AMOUNTS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE I, PART II ARE GRANTS. THESE AMOUNTS ARE DONATIONS AND SPONSORSHIPS GIVEN TO ORGANIZATIONS TO ASSIST IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THEIR CHARITABLE MISSION. YNHH VERIFIES EACH ORGANIZATION'S EIN AS LISTED ON IRS FORM W-9 THAT HAS BEEN SUBMITTED TO YNHH. ASSISTANCE DONATED BY YNHH TO THESE QUALIFYING ORGANIZATIONS IS NOT OUTCOMES-BASED AND IS GIVEN IN SUPPORT OF AN INDIVIDUAL ORGANIZATION'S FUNDRAISING EVENTS OR IN SUPPORT OF DIRECT SERVICES. YNHH MAINTAINS FULL AND COMPLETE RECORDS OF ALL MONETARY ASSISTANCE PROVIDED, HOWEVER DOES NOT MONITOR SPECIFIC FUNDS.
STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS MONITORED BY INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND A COMMITTEE OF EMPLOYEES WITH RESPONSIBILITY TO ENSURE THE INSTRUCTION GUIDELINES ARE PROPERLY FOLLOWED.

GRANT FUNDING IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS THROUGH THE ADMISSION PROCESS AS WELL AS THROUGH THE COMPLETION OF THE ANNUAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). UPON ACCEPTANCE TO THE UNIVERSITY, IF DETERMINED ELIGIBLE BY ADMISSIONS, TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS ARE AWARDED WITH INSTITUTIONAL MERIT OR PARTNERSHIP AID. WHEN THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL PLANNING (SFP) PACKAGES STUDENT AID, THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO THE ELIGIBLE STUDENT. ONCE THE STUDENT HAS FILED THE FAFSA FORM, ADDITIONAL AID INCLUDING FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT/LOAN FUNDS ARE AWARDED AS WELL. IF FINANCIAL AID FILES ARE COMPLETED WITH MISSING DOCUMENTATION, STUDENT AID AWARDS ARE REVIEWED AND REVISED AS NECESSARY. THE SFP OFFICE WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE STUDENT ACCOUNT OFFICE (SAO) TO RECONCILE INSTITUTIONAL, FEDERAL, AND GRANT FUNDING ON AN ONGOING BASIS THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR. REPORTS ARE RUN FROM THE SFP OFFICE AND SENT TO SAO TO REVIEW AND IDENTIFY ANY AID DISCREPANCIES. IF ANY ARE IDENTIFIED, THE AID IS ADJUSTED AS NECESSARY. THE SFP OFFICE REQUESTS A YEAR-TO-DATE FEDERAL PELL GRANT FILE FROM COD EVERY COUPLE OF MONTHS TO RECONCILE THE AWARDING, DISBURSEMENT, AND CANCELLATION OF A STUDENT'S GRANT AWARDS. AS THE AWARD YEAR COMES TO AN END, REPORTS MAY BE RUN ON A WEEKLY BASIS FROM THE SFP, SAO, AND COD SYSTEMS TO BE SURE ALL THE FUNDING AWARDED IS RECONCILED ACCURATELY.

The purpose of the RSF General Nursing Scholarship Program is to financially support continued education of high performing, exemplary staff nurses and students to meet a specific nursing workforce strategic need (i.e. hard to fill nursing positions or educational goals as determined by RSF senior nursing leaders.

THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION IS A LONGSTANDING SECTION 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION CLASSIFIED AS A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE GRANT TO THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION IS BEING MADE IN CONNECTION WITH THE DISSOLUTION OF THE TAXPAYER. THE TAXPAYER HAS CONDUCTED EXTENSIVE DUE DILIGENCE ON THE RECIPIENT'S PLANNED USE OF FUNDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES AND HAS CAUSED THE RECIPIENT TO ENTER INTO A GRANT AGREEMENT WITH THE TAXPAYER. UNDER THE AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT HAS AGREED TO ONLY USE THE GRANTED FUNDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES CONSISTENT WITH SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE CODE. THE GRANT AGREEMENT CONTAINS FURTHER RESTRICTIONS ON THE USE OF FUNDS FOR LOBBYING, ANY CAMPAIGN FOR CANDIDATE FOR PUBLIC OFFICE, AND OTHER PROHIBITED ACTIVITIES. A COPY OF THE GRANT AGREEMENT IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. CHU HAS CONTINUED TO MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS BY THE RECIPIENT TO THE EXTENT CONSISTENT WITH ITS DISSOLUTION ACTIVITIES, AND CHU IS SATISFIED THAT THE RECIPIENT IS ACTING IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO ITS EXPENDITURE OF GRANTED FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHOSE STAFF IS TRAINED AND CONTINUOUSLY EDUCATED REGARDING FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE STAFF OF THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT AND DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT CAN BE AWARDED TO THE STUDENT BASED ON FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF ALSO AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ENDOWED GIFTS THAT COMPLY WITH THE TERMS OF THE ENDOWED GIFTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The Contributions Committee of Bryan Health oversees the grant allocation and management for this organization. Each potential recipient is required to apply for a grant. The Contributions Committee reviews and discusses all submitted requests in detail. Grants are awarded based on need and eligibility.

GRANTS ARE PRIMARILY MONITORED IN THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF WRITTEN AND ELECTRONIC DOCUMENTATION. STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DEEMED WORTHY BY THE COLLEGE'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

Grants to governments and organizations are made and monitored by College personnel in support of local community relations. College's Grants to individuals are made and monitored in accordance with Federal and Institutional Financial Aid policies. Amounts are applied to student accounts as credits to the bill at the bursar's office to offset academic charges.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are granted to deserving students based on the terms of the grant establishing the particular scholarship fund. For example, some scholarships are available only to students in the Missions Department, or Music majors, etc., while some scholarships funds can be given to any student who can show a need.Scholarships and grants are placed on student receivable accounts except in a few exceptional cases. If there is a credit balance left on the student account no amounts are refunded until any unused scholarships or grants are reversed.

DESCRIBE ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. THE UNIVERSITY REQUIRES THAT WHEN APPROVING INVOICE PAYMENTS TO SUBRECIPIENTS, THE VALIDITY OF EXPENSES MUST BE VERIFIED ALONG WITH THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL PROGRESS BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE. THIS VERIFICATION INCLUDES SIGN OFF BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE ON THE INVOICE APPROVING IT FOR PAYMENT. SUBRECIPIENT INVOICES SHOULD INCLUDE INFORMATION THAT CONFORMS TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS AS PRESCRIBED IN 2 CFR 200, AS APPLICABLE. SUBRECIPIENTS EXEMPT FROM 2 CFR 200 AUDIT REQUIREMENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAKE THEIR FINANCIAL RECORDS AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW OR AUDIT BY FEDERAL AGENCIES OR PASS-THRU ENTITIES AS REQUESTED, UNDER THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THEIR AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL AWARDS TO STUDENTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE. DOCUMENTATION REGARDING ELIGIBILITY IS MAINTAINED IN EACH STUDENT'S FILE. CRITERIA FOR INSTITUTIONAL AID IS DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND VARIOUS COMMITTEES. ALSO, MANY INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DONOR-FUNDED AND CONTAIN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA SPECIFIED BY THE DONOR.

BRIDGEPORT HOSPITAL ("BH") CARRIES OUT DUE DILIGENCE IN PROVIDING MONETARY ASSISTANCE ONLY TO QUALIFYING 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS THAT COMPLEMENT ITS MISSION OR SUPPORT THE GREATER GOOD IN THE COMMUNITIES SERVES. NONE OF THE AMOUNTS REPORTED ON SCHEDULE I, PART III ARE GRANTS. THESE AMOUNTS ARE ASSISTANCES GIVEN TO CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS TO ASSIST IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THEIR CHARITABLE MISSION. BH VERIFIES EACH ORGANIZATION'S EIN AS LISTED ON IRS FORM W-9 THAT HAS BEEN SUBMITTED TO BH. ASSISTANCE DONATED BY BH TO THESE QUALIFYING ORGANIZATIONS IS NOT OUTCOMES-BASED AND IS GIVEN IN SUPPORT OF AN INDIVIDUAL ORGANIZATION'S FUNDRAISING EVENTS OR IN SUPPORT OF DIRECT SERVICES. BH MAINTAINS FULL AND COMPLETE RECORDS OF ALL MONETARY ASSISTANCE PROVIDED, HOWEVER DOES NOT MONITOR SPECIFIC FUNDS.

STUDENT AID IS PROVIDED ONLY TO ENROLLED STUDENTS WITH NEED AND WHO ALSO MEET ALL OF THE OTHER FEDERAL AID OR INSTITUTIONAL REQUIREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH ACADEMIC YEAR AND TERM WITH FREQUENT PERIODIC UPDATES. RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BY THE STUDENT AFFAIRS COMMITTEE BASED ON PUBLISHED CRITERIA. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS.

GRANTS CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA AND ELIGIBILITY EACH SEMESTER FOR EVERY STUDENT. WITHDRAWALS FROM CLASSES REQUIRE THE STUDENT TO HAVE A FORM SIGNED BY THE ACADEMIC OFFICE, THE BUSINESS OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED IS PRO-RATED BASED ON FEDERAL REGULATIONS.

ALL FIRST-TIME STUDENTS TO MITCHELL COLLEGE ARE REVIEWED FOR MERIT AID. THERE IS NO SEPARATE APPLICATION PROCESS. IF STUDENTS ARE AWARDED MERIT AID, THE NOTIFICATION LETTER WILL BE SENT ABOUT TWO WEEKS AFTER THEIR ACCEPTANCE LETTER ARRIVES. MERIT AID IS BASED ON ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND/OR COMMUNITY SERVICE INVOLVEMENT. STUDENTS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN OBTAINING NEED BASED AID, EITHER FROM FEDERAL AND STATE RESOURCES OR MITCHELL COLLEGE'S OWN FUNDS MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AT WWW.FAFSA.ED.GOV. FINANCIAL AID, SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS AWARDED IS APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH A REDUCTION IN TUITION CHARGES.

A STUDENT MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION FOR THE GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. THE STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE SEEKING PROGRAM; NON MATRICULATED STUDENTS ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. STUDENTS MUST ENROLL FOR AT LEAST 6 CREDITS TO RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDS, EXCEPT STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR THE PELL GRANT PROGRAM. UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 2.0 AND GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.0 EACH SEMESTER.

SAINT PETER'S UNIVERSITY ("UNIVERSITY") PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY FOR VARIOUS REASONS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, STUDENT INSTITUTIONAL AID AND ATHLETICS. THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.

All Oak Hills Christian College scholarships are monitored by the Financial Aid Office with attention given to the criteria set forth for each award as well as the student's enrollment status. The scholarships are applied directly to the student accounts. Camp scholarship assistance is available for campers whose families are financially unable to send their children to camp. The camper must be registered with a $25 deposit and submit a scholarship request form. The amount of scholarship requested will be applied to the camper's registration fee. A camper may request only one scholarship per calendar year. CIM(MMC) scholarships are awared based upon student need.

ONCE THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP HAVE BEEN REVIEWED AND MET, GFU DISBURSES FINANCIAL AID FUNDS TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNT DIRECTLY, ENSURING THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED FOR TUITION AND EDUCATIONAL COSTS.

Appalachian Bible College awards various scholarships to students for the purpose of assisting with tuition and related college expenses. Students must meet eligibility requirements before funds are awarded. Awards are applied directly to student accounts.

TO ENSURE OUR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR THE PROPER PURPOSES THE EDGEWOOD COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE PERFORMS REGULAR MAINTENANCE AND RECONCILIATIONS WITH OUR BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORING THAT ALL FUNDS AWARDED TO A PARTICULAR STUDENT ARE BEING PROPERLY CREDITED TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT. ANY CHANGES OR ADJUSTMENTS TO ORIGINAL AWARDS THAT AFFECT GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING ARE MADE WITHIN POWERFAIDS, THE FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE PROGRAM. THESE CHANGES TO AWARDS ARE ELECTRONICALLY TRANSMITTED AT LEAST WEEKLY TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE RESULTING CHANGES ARE THEN DISPLAYED ON THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS THE ABILITY TO GENERATE REPORTS AS NEEDED FOR MONITORING AND RECONCILIATION PURPOSES. THESE REPORTS ARE COMPARED TO REPORTS GENERATED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE THAT ALL PROGRAM AMOUNTS ARE ACCURATELY REFLECTED. ADDITIONALLY, WE HAVE A YEARLY AUDIT PERFORMED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM GUARANTEEING WE ARE STAYING IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS WELL AS ASSURING FUNDING IS BEING USED AS INTENDED.

THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH STUDENT'S NEEDS AND THE AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE STUDENT'S CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE THE ASSISTANCE.

CONCORDIA COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF MERIT AND NEED. FIRST YEAR STUDENTS MAY BE AWARDED SPECIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON NEED AND MERIT AS DETERMINED BY THE APPLICANT'S APPLICATION AND AUDITION. SECOND YEAR AND ACADEMY COMPANY STUDENTS MAY APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS BY WRITING TO THE ACADEMY'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHICH MAKES ALL SCHOLARSHIP DECISIONS. DETAILS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

The financial aid office at William Jessup University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State and institutional grants, scholarships, and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University. Financial aid awarded is applied directly to student accounts and no cash changes hands. Occasional grants are awarded to 501(c)(3) organizations that support education and whose exempt purpose are consistent with the University's mission.

MERIT-BASED FELLOWSHIPS ARE GRANTED TO RESIDENT ARTISTS TO OFFSET THE COST OF LIVING EXPENSES WHILE ATTENDING AVA. THE AMOUNTS ARE DETERMINED ANNUALLY AND PAID MONTHLY. SUMMER STUDY GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FOR APPROVED IMMERSION PROGRAMS. PROOF OF ACCEPTANCE INTO THE PROGRAM AND ATTENDANCE ARE PROVIDED TO AVA.

PROCEDURES FOR APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID: WHENEVER POSSIBLE, CATAWBA COLLEGE WILL SUPPLEMENT THE FINANCIAL RESOURCES OF A STUDENT THROUGH MERIT, PERFORMANCE-BASED, AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. A POTENTIAL STUDENT APPLIES AND IS ACCEPTED TO CATAWBA COLLEGE. AT THE TIME OF THEIR ACCEPTANCE, MERIT AID IS DETERMINED BY THE ADMISSIONS COUNSELOR ACCEPTING THE APPLICATION BASED ON A MATRIX CHART THAT HAS BEEN SET UP WITH REGARD TO GPA AND SAT SCORES, LIVING ON OR OFF CAMPUS, AND A SEPARATE TRANSFER STUDENT MATRIX. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AND, THUS, MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. WITH REGARDS TO ATHLETICS AT CATAWBA COLLEGE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL ATHLETES TO MAKE SURE THEY DO NOT GO OVER CONFERENCE REGULATIONS REGARDING BOOKS AND SUPPLIES. CATAWBA COLLEGE REFERS TO THE NCAA DIVISION II MANUAL FOR POLICIES REGARDING STUDENT ATHLETES. THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR SIGNS OFF ON THE SQUAD LISTS AND CHECKS FOR ELIGIBILITY WITH THE COMPLIANCE DIRECTOR. THE ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENTERING THE ATHLETIC INFORMATION INTO THE CAI SYSTEM. THE CAI SYSTEM IS ALSO USED TO DETERMINE EQUIVALENCY COMPUTATIONS.

Kettering Medical Center employees may apply for up to $400 per qualifying hardship event. The lifetime maximum for an employee is capped at $1,000. Kettering College maintains the criteria used for awarding institutional scholarships. Some of the scholarships awarded by Kettering College are based on need, others are awarded strictly based on merit, and others are awarded based on both need and merit. Funds are monitored and use is determined by board members. The scholarship award is a teen volunteer award.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MERCY COLLEGE OF OHIO FOLLOWS THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR TITLE IV GRANTS AND THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE OHIO BOARD OF REGENTS FOR ALL STATE GRANTS.

DOANE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS ACCORDING TO POLICY CRITERIA WHICH RECOGNIZE FACTORS SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SPECIAL ABILITIES, AND FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. RESTRICTED GRANT FUNDS WITH SPECIFIC AWARD CRITERIA ARE ADMINISTERED BY FINANCIAL AID TO SELECT STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE GRANT.

The students complete applications for receipt of scholarship funds to be used for their education. These funds are then applied to their tuition balances. No cash changes hands. Awards are determined by a scholarship committee. Tuition discounts are also extended to qualified individuals.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING OF SCHOLARSHIPS - THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE NOTIFIES THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF AMOUNTS AVAILABLE TO AWARD TO STUDENTS EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE SELECTS RECIPIENTS BASED UPON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED FOR EACH TYPE OF FUNDING. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE OF EXPENDITURES FOR EACH TERM DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR. AT YEAR-END, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND ACCOUNTING OFFICE RECONCILE ACCOUNTS FOR ALL FUNDS. THE ADVANCEMENT OFFICE PROVIDES ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE DONORS REGARDING THE USE OF DONOR-CONTRIBUTED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS (ENDOWED OR ANNUALLY FUNDED). PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING RESEARCH GRANTS - THERE ARE SEVERAL DIFFERENT DEPARTMENTS THAT OFFER RESEARCH GRANTS AT WILLAMETTE. EACH DEPARTMENT HAS DIFFERENT MONITORING PROCEDURES FOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. HOWEVER, THE MONITORING PROCEDURES TYPICALLY INVOLVE THE FOLLOWING: A WRITTEN AND/OR VERBAL REPORT ON THE RESEARCH PROJECT MUST BE SUBMITTED DURING AND/OR AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROJECT; RECEIPTS MUST BE SUBMITTED FOR REIMBURSEMENT OF PROJECT EXPENDITURES. FINAL PAYMENT OF GRANT FUNDS IS OFTEN CONTINGENT ON THE AFOREMENTIONED ITEMS. THE DEPARTMENT THAT AWARDS THE GRANTS HANDLES THE RELATED MONITORING OF THOSE GRANT FUNDS. PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING OTHER AWARDS AND PRIZES - AWARD/PRIZE RECIPIENTS ARE DETERMINED BY CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE RESPECTIVE DEPARTMENTS. DEPARTMENTS WORK WITH THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE TO MAKE SURE THAT THE AWARD FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE CORRECT STUDENT OR FACULTY MEMBER.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: THROUGH THE CHILDREN'S MIRACLE NETWORK, LESTER E. COX MEDICAL CENTERS DISTRIBUTES FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. SEE BELOW FOR A SUMMARY OF PROGRAMS THROUGH WHICH FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED. COX MEDICAL CENTERS GUARANTEED GRANTS - $525,581 TOTAL *CHILD LIFE PROGRAM - $147,210 *C.A.R.E.
